Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: lissings
Reviews.Content: First off, I was upgraded to a suite (mid-week in February) which was a lovely surprise. Staff was all very accomodating and pleasant. Views from my corner room were just spectacular and bed was very comfortable. Internet was $10 for the day and worked well. Nice location from which to just take a stroll around Manhattan's Upper-Eastside. Close to Sotheby's Auction House and almost under the 59th Street Bridge. Didn't eat in the restaurant, but went and checked it out - - really nice atmosphere and fabulous views. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF STAYED 1 DAY CHARGED FOR 2”
Reviews.Author: lizjaz
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for two nights, did not prepay. I contacted the front desk at 9am the morning of day 2 and told them I was leaving early because my plans had changed. The clerk said okay and I asked her to email me the bill. I got the bill and was charged for both days. Spent hours on the phone with clerks, supervisors and managers and was told everything from that is our cancellation policy, (which is not what was written on my confirmation) to well because you were there until 9:00 am that is technically the second day. NO HELP from anyone, in fact they acted as if I was ripping them off... Beside that when I arrived at 7:30 PM, I still had to wait 30 minutes for my room...

Reviews.Title: “Bentley Hotel New York”
Reviews.Author: DanielWilks
Reviews.Content: I was Worried after looking at some reviews about this Hotel but I'm pleased I choose to stay there!! we arrived and was given our room, which was nice not amazing but when your planning be out most time it was a nice place come back too, Reception rang our room within 10minutes to make sure we were happy with the room which was nice!! the Hotel is about 15minute walk from central Park we walked most places got the odd cab or subway from time to time( my fiancée is 14 weeks Pregnant she found the walking ok, so it not really a problem, even on our last day the hotel had there own car to take us back to the hotel, the car had so much room we really did go back in style to the airport, great staff, great hotel, not exact in centre town, but nice get away from there to sleep well at same time

Reviews.Title: “WOW, what an amazing veiw”
Reviews.Author: lahh1
Reviews.Content: checked in at the bentley hotel we had a room on the 18th floor, what an amazing veiw large glass windows overlooking the roosevelt bridge and east river the room was perfect the bed was massive and the room was clean and spacious. the bathroom did have a bit of mould but not that bad, the staff was very friendly and helpful at the same time as we checked in harry from towie also checked in. the nearest subway is a bit of a walk but that wasnt a problem for us we even walked to timesquare from our hotel. its about $10 for a taxi from times square to the bentley. the lift in the hotel was a bit slow but apart from that we had no complaints the cleaners cleaned our room every day with clean towels everyday. i felt safe at night walking back from the subway to hotel. i was very worried from reading the reveiws on this hotel but i can honestly say i loved this hotel and so did my partner we would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel. Not good value for price paid, though.”
Reviews.Author: Luz1980
Reviews.Content: The star of this hotel is the view. So you NEED to ask for a higher floor. Lower floors are probably loud. Let me start by saying that I keep in mind that NY accommodations are always more expensive than in other places, and the rooms in every hotel I´ve been to in NY are always so small you can´t even fit your luggage. So having said this, the Bentley has nicely sized rooms, at least I could see that at the Junior Suite. But the Bentley has a few issues that are easy to improve, and they shouldn´t be present in a +300 USD a night hotel. Let me point out some examples: Housekeeping: by far the worst part. The bathroom was not properly cleaned even once during our stay. Toiletries were never ever replaced. There was only one soap in the bathroom, which as soon as we arrived, we had to share for showering and washing our hands. So we had to ask for more soap. When they did, they also sent us a bottle of champagne as a honeymoon welcome, which we appreciate very much, but the next day after the room had been serviced, the empty bottle, bucket and used glasses were still there, right on the table. I was also very surprised to notice that they don´t have a "used towel policy" (bathtub means replace, hook means will use again), but they wouldn´t necessarily replace the towels we left in the bathtub either. Smaller, face towels were NEVER replaced, so after we had used the second one, no more face towels for us! One day my husband accidentally left a towel on the bed, by the time we came back, the towel had been placed extended on the bed (?), instead of being hung on a rack or replaced. Maintenance: another poor aspect. The heat was not working, and we were fortunate enough to have two not-so-cold days and nights in NY winter, but by the third day it became really cold again, so that night we could have used some decent heating. The result? I caught a pretty bad cold that night while sleeping, so when I left for the day next morning, I asked the front desk to send maintenance to my room to check on that. Maintenance never did, or if they did and couldn´t solve the issue, at least they never informed the front desk or us. So when we came back in the evening, the room was freezing (they had left the A/C crazy cold). I had to ask for extra blankets and heaters to be brought up, which they did (front desk staff was great all the time I must say). By the end of next day, after I had complained again, the heat was finally fixed. The water in the shower was cold though... guess we were not so lucky :) Last but not least: no turndown service and no trash can in the room. Just a small one in the bathroom. No minifridge either, although they are available upon request. These are the small things I was saying could be easily fixed and instantly provide a better service. But the views are great, and so is location. And the restaurant too. Next time I´ll go somewhere else, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AggyD
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a "destination" hotel, you should probably look elsewhere, but if you're looking for a clean, very reasonably priced hotel in Manhattan with incredibly comfortable beds and a safe neighborhood, you simply cannot go wrong with this hotel. My husband was in NY Presbyterian for surgery and this hotel was the perfect "home away from home" for me. It was an easy walk to the hospital in a very safe neighborhood at any time of the day or night. The staff was extremely helpful and the restaurant on the top floor was very good (and the views are great too!). I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. If you need to be near the medical centers - stay here!! If you don't need to be near the medical centers, you should still stay here! It's an easy four block walk to the subway or a quick cab ride to Grand Central. This will always be my first choice for a hotel in Manhattan from now on. Also, I booked through Expedia which, I believe, gave me a slightly lower rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View - Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: The Bentley is near the East River, a nice view from the restaurant. The hotel is a bit thread bare, the furniture has seen better days. The bedding is also worn and need of new mattresses. The decor is NY Zen, was nice when new but the metallic vinyl wears poorly. The staff is very nice, and helpful. The neighborhood is a bit drab with only fair restaurants, They have a 24 hour cancellation policy so if you change plans beware.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but tired.”
Reviews.Author: TJ1666
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the hotel location and it was clean with friendly staff. The only downside was that the place is a bit tired looking with furniture in the rooms that has seen better days and few extras like a coffee pot or refrigerator. Plenty of restaurants and bars in the local area and easy transport.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: theoatybear
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via one of those Expedia offers where you don't know the exact hotel until after you buy it. Once we knew the hotel name, we read the reviews online. Seemed okay and since it was going to be a short stay in New York we weren't that worried. The place looked great when we got there. The only draw back was when we were checking in. The young man working at the front desk was aloof and not particularly helpful. Besides for this young man, the rest of the staff was very friendly. Our room was very spacious too and we had a fantastic view of the bridge. The location is great. The subway is nearby and there are plently of restaurants and cafes in the neighborhood. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Blocks away from Central Park”
Reviews.Author: drewquinones
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fun trip to NYC. Stayed at the Bentley Hotel for 4 nights. Pros: Great deal. Clean. Comfortable. Cons: Closet subway is 4 blocks away. No car entry way, you cannot park on the street, or even leave your car on the street while you check in. Parking is on the other side of the building and is expensive. Rooms are small. They said to have a great view from the Roof Bar, but we didn't even go up, preferred to explore the city. All in all a good experience staying there. I recommend it if you don't mind walking.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary view!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyflies
Reviews.Content: Just finished my third stay and enjoyed it very much. This hotel has really improved since my first stay five years ago. I definitely can recommend it now and would have no hesitation about going back. Five years ago previous staff members were trying so hard to be hip they were unhelpful to the point of insolence. Things had improved by a few years ago, but now the hotel has it right. Everyone is pleasant and professional, always smiling and asking how they can help. My room on a high floor was clean, comfortable and attractively decorated in a modern way. Its view was spectacular, almost "star wars" like at dusk when the lights from passing rush hour traffic illuminated both levels of the bridge, the FDR Drive and the local streets. The Roosevelt Island funiculars passing back and forth on their cables high in the air and boats going by on the East River only added to the effect. If someone wants to experience a dazzling NYC skyline at a reasonable price, a room facing south at The Bentley can not be beat. It is true that sometimes you can hear other guests - mostly in the halls where is seems some people forget to speak quietly. The walls are not that thick, however I never had a problem sleeping in any of my stays. The hotel is located near world class hospitals - both people's and animal's. It's an easy walk to NY Hospital/ Cornell Medical Center, Rockefeller University, Sloan Kettering and the hundreds of doctors offices clustered around them, as well as the Animal Medical Center which is right next door. Midtown is also very convenient with great shopping not far away. Taxi's are plentiful and the subway to more distant parts is at 59th and Lex. Not next door, but not an unpleasant walk either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natalie B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, convenient, the beds were very comfortable, the view was spectacular. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Three Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: ExcitedNYS
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed during apartment renovation. Very responsive manager addressed need to change room rate when we checked in. Staff (front desk/greeting person at main entrance) very responsive. Bed very comfortable, room clean, well appointed. Had fabulous view of 59th street bridge/river on upper floor. Could hear guests talking in adjacent room at times. Room rates change frequently; we received very low rate for two of three days. Did not use wi-fi, restaurant, or exercise room. Starbucks coffee available in lobby for reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Views, Good East Side Location”
Reviews.Author: emeraldisle45
Reviews.Content: If you need to be on the upper east side near NY Presbyterian, Cornell or Sloan-Kettering, this location at York and 62nd is ideal though the busy street 62nd entrance the FDR Drive in front is heavy with traffic. We had a quiet corner room with spectacular views of the East River, the 59th St. Bridge and the Roosevelt Island Cable Cars. The top floor restaurant/bar would give you these views if your room is not river side. Room was clean and modern, but a bit tight. Two light bulbs were out, but that was quickly corrected by staff. One day our room was not made up, but that was also quickly corrected. For the price, we thought it was a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nina c
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bentley this past weekend and was surprisingly impressed. I'll be undergoing some surgeries in the city and since I live 3 hours away my husband and I needed to find a hotel to stay in. I tried several hotels in the area and all of them were upwards of $300.00 a night. Being that the surgeries are bleeding us dry, I needed to find a less expensive hotel and wound up at the Bentley.l was pleasantly surprised upon entering. The staff was pleasant and very helpful and our room was great. Clean, comfortable, stylish, and a great view. I was also greeted with a note on the desk letting me know that they were there if I needed anything while I was going through this difficult time. I found that to be very comforting and personalized my stay with them. I wasn't just another customer! I've got enough to deal with as I go through these surgeries and I'm glad I found The Bentley, it'll be one less thing I will need to worry about. I will continually use the Bentley for all my hotel needs in the future. NinaC.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL ROOM...WALL TO WALL”
Reviews.Author: Sasivino
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Bentley from Feb 19th to 21st... Booked a King Deluxe Room for my boyfriend and myself for his birthday weekend. Not at all what I thought it would be, our room was very small, wall to wall. The amenities listed on the website had not been in the room upon our arrival. Our bathroom light switch was not working, No i-pod dock, No Fresh towels were set out and we had no control over our air vent. After my boyfriend called and made complaints to the front desk they made sure to come correct their mistakes immediately. For our troubles The Bentley provided us with a Complimentary Bottle of Red Wine & Boxed Chocolates and Complimentary breakfast at their ROOFTOP restaurant.The sites were amazing from the rooftop overlooking Queensboro bridge. But the breakfast wasn't so great, we ate "Bentley Omelets" but the eggs were runny, but the pancakes and cinnamon toast was passable. The Front desk provides print out of near by dinning, our favorite was "Burger Heaven". I'm not quite sure if I'd recommend Bentley to a friend but that was just our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth1306
Reviews.Content: First we thought the price is great for a hotel in NYC but we did not expect very much. After more than a week at the Bentley Hotel I can say for sure that we will NEVER go there again, because everything is substandard. Here are our details: The location is about 15 minutes away from the next subway station. That is in fact the least handicap of this hotel! The rooms are very small and a bit shabby. The floor was dirty and was not cleaned after I asked for it. It took three days... A very small and smelly closet was hidden behind a strange door, where you could hear your neighbors as if there were in your room. The view was great, but it guess that is the only plus. The bathroom has no ventilation and turns, if you get some hot water, which is rare, into a sauna. There were not enough towels and toilet paper. Again I had to asked but did not get anything on the same day. The bar is the worst rooftop bar I have seen so far. Breakfast is expensive and not wort half of the price. At any diner around the corner you can get a better deal. Service is unfriendly and slowly. There are NO amenities! No coffee maker (just an small pricy coffee bar in the lobby with an every day very unfriendly woman), no mini-bar (just a few bottles standing together with the TV on the desk- no space), no free internet (but nevertheless extreme slowly). The elevator took ages! Worst thing was that somebody stole clothes and toys of our room and the management told us that they could not do anything because MANY people of the hotel had access to our hotel room. They could not find out what happened. For two day we had problems ending at the police and filing a report. The hotel did not help us in any way, but the officer told us that he had been there a few times before because of the same reason. All together it was a bad experience in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST. Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Pdag510
Reviews.Content: We chose Bentley hotel for our girls weekend in the city to celebrate my friends birthday, and were not disappointed!! I called the day before to confirm the reservation and ensure our room had a good view, Augustine answered and was friendly and professional. When we arrived we were greeted by Augustine at the front desk, he was able to give us a room upgrade for our weekend and the room was spectacular!! The hotel and our suite was very clean, bright and well decorated! The views at the rooftop restaurant is breath taking and the food was delicious and nicely presented. After a day of shopping we arrived back at our room and to our surprise, there was a bottle of champagne chilling and a note from the hotel saying happy b'day and thanking us for choosing bently hotel along with dark chocolates! Just a perfect experience!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, amazing views, great staff”
Reviews.Author: KLMNC
Reviews.Content: First let me share that I've taken MANY trips to NYC for business and stayed in some of the BEST hotels (at my employers expense), and I feel confident recommending this hotel to travels who aren't on an unlimited expense account. *I would come back to The Bentley Hotel on or off an expense account! I spent four great nights at The Bentley Hotel Feb 2012 (personal trip/mini-vacation). I booked thru HOTWIRE and got a SUPER deal on an already reasonably priced room. (3rd night free!) The entire staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, paying great attention to the details and accommodating my every request...even helping me figure out the Subway system (no easy task to an out-of-towner!) I'd like to give a special SHOUT OUT to Sasha at the front desk for her great suggestions which helped me find exactly what I was looking for in the Fashion District (beads/buttons). The room was HUGE (by NYC standards) and my VIEW of Roosevelt Island and the Queens Bridge was INCREDIBLE! The roof top restaurant had an amazing brunch (with more amazing views). I had an amazing stay and look forward to coming back soon. It's a wee bit off the beaten track for many travelers but is in a great area with everything you would want, restaurants, coffee shops, shopping and a 10 minute walk to Central Park. The location appealed even more when I realized how QUIET it was the first morning I woke up (without the constant HONKING of cabs). Couple of random (and hopefully helpful) notes: The hotel is VERY close to La Guardia Airport ~ My shared shuttle had me here in about 20 minutes! ($14) *that's pretty awesome!! It is about a $25 cab ride to Chelsea/SoHo area. (or a $2.50 subway ride with one transfer) Angels on 62nd (or is it 61st?) is a GREAT place to grab an Italian meal!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you want the silence of New York and view of Roosevelt Island”
Reviews.Author: Paulnairobi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel in October 2011 and it was great! Having read many not so good reviews I had to call the hotel and get an assurance. Good meals (I only had breakfast-and it was the same menu for all the three days!), The view from 16th floor upwards is great, but only if you book a room facing the Roosevelt Island since the hotel is sandwiched between large buildings that make any other view worthless. If you do not manage to get a good upper room (19th would be the best) then try spending your time at the restaurant. It has an excellent view of the River. Sadly when I got home I found my debit card had been charged for services I do not know since I had confirmed the amounts I owe. And they do not manage the internet in the rooms, so you have to call the external people whenever you have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Poshbird232
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Bentley which is in a great location. Approx 20 mins walk to Central park , easy to get to Bloomingdales, Macy's, 42nd street and 5th avenue . Never paid more than Â£10 for a taxi and even used the hotels limo service which was same price as a yellow cab . Before arriving in New York I did my own due diligence on the hotel after reading some pretty awful reviews , I emailed the hotel directly voicing my concerns on the reviews I had read. After three emails the director of rooms Brett Caspi called me personally to discuss my concerns. I was so pleased with this level of care and service that immediately all my fears were gone. I discussed with Brett that we would prefer a room on a high floor with views of the Queensborough bridge and also requested a coffee maker and a refrigerator . This was all confirmed , however upon check in things did not go quite as planned ! The guy on check in did not honour any of our requests stating that as I did not make the booking directly with the hotel and through booking.com that no special requirements could be accomodated and also the hotel was very busy ! Excuse me I made the booking in August 2011 , so you have known about it for 6 months and now your telling me your busy ! He was not the slightest bit interested that I had been speaking directly with the director of rooms prior to my arrival. I explained that I had email correspondence to back this up but as I could not show him (due to not being able to log on to my ipad) he was not interested. I asked for the director of rooms but he was not working. Also whilst checking us in he answered the telephone 4 times which I consider to be extremely rude and discourteous , no concern for the client he is dealing with . I have to say that this individual was rude, showed no concern for my requests and to be honest I doubted what our stay was going to be like if all the staff were so disinterested . Our room which I have to say was quite spacious for a twin and nicley furnished with a nice view even though it was on the 7th floor but not what I had requested , so I emailed the director of rooms my concerns and frustrations over the dreadful check in experience and requested that we meet the following day to discuss my concerns and disappointment . Within 30 mins I received a phone call from the same rude guy who checked us in , saying that Brett had picked up the email and had called in to apologise for the mis communication over the booking and as a gesture of goodwill they offered us dinner in the Resturant during our stay and a transfer to a room on the 18th floor with a coffee maker and refridgerator . We said we would move in the morning as we were a little tired. The following morning we went to reception to make arrangements to move rooms and were told the room wasn't ready ............ Erh what's going on ? It was available last night now it's not, we were then told I would be ready after 2pm and it had city view ! Mmmmmm I had requested a river view , so as you can imagine I was somewhat frustrated by now when the general manager appeared . Augustine (GM) was very apologetic and offered to move us to a suite on 18th floor at no extra cost , Brett then introduced himself and apologised for the inconvenience we had encountered. I have to say that both Brett and Augustine were both very accommodating and showed a high level of customer service unlike the guy on the font desk on check in , he could learn a lot from them both . Brett made reservations for us at The Smith which I recommend for Sunday brunch or any other day , the food and the atmosphere were fabulous and Brett even emailed the following day to check if we had enjoyed the Smith which I thought was a nice touch. Throughout our stay Brett and Augustine exceeded my expectations and made our stay at the Bentley a most pleasurable experience . The front door staff were just fabulous , so friendly and always had a big smile to greet you. I would recommend the Bentley and don't believe everything you read on here , If I had believed all the reviews I would have not stayed here, one reviewer told me to cancel and book elsewhere , I'm glad I didn't as we had a nice stay and met some great people . Whenever we ordered ice or champagne glasses in arrival back in the hotel they arrived at the room before we did ! That's what I call service (**,) We were so happy we didn't even take up the offer of a free dinner in the restaurant as we appreciated the upgrade to a suite which was more than enough. The only negative is there is nowhere to do your hair or makeup , a small mirror would have been great and some brighter lighting ! Other than that is was great .

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: William N
Reviews.Content: Everything is old, the road outside could be heard clearly, carpet in Lobby dirty, checked out after 2 nights. Rather go to time square for slightly more, and 100% better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: oibarra3
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at this property and was pleased by the fantastic location, one block off the East River, you are within walking distance of Saks, Bloomis, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, the Theatre District and the adorable Dylan's Candy Bar. There are several places to eat nearby inluding my favorite Mr Chows on 57th. The service was reasonable the property is nice enough, the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Bentley!”
Reviews.Author: jett860
Reviews.Content: I flew into NYC on Jan. 29th, 2012 to stay at the Holiday Inn on 31st St. while on a business trip. It was a complete nightmare. The desk clerks were rude, obnoxious and didn't know what they were doing. They ended up putting a hold on 900 on my credit card by accident. I was so frustrated I decided to not stay there and try a hotel uptown that I'd stay in during a past trip. The manager, Augustine (I think that's how you say it), was so nice and courteous. He took care of me and my guest and checked on us the entire time. The entire dynamic of the trip was changed by the hotel change. On Tuesday after I had my business taken care of I had almost forgotten the night before and could concentrate on enjoying the city. The suite was so nice. I loved the view. My friend stayed on a roll away in the living room. It worked out great since the heat was in the living room and my friend loved sleeping in really warm temperatures and I didn't. I'd suggest this hotel to anyone who wants to go to NYC. I should have stayed there in the first place but wanted to be closer to where I was intially going. I won't make that mistake again. I think the Bentley was a fantastic place to stay. I checked out yesterday, Feb. 1, and I'm still missing it. I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: nycloverBostonMa
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are nicely appointed, they are NYC-tiny, tiny, tiny. Attentive and helpful staff make the hotel feel comfortable. The breakfast buffet, however, is overpriced and mediocre, at best. For a good meal at reasonable price, walk one block to the Ritz Diner. Don't miss their blueberry pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for the money - with a little service upgrade could be great”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel over the weekend checking in on a Friday. When we reached the front desk, we were told their computers were down so they couldn't tell which rooms had been cleaned, they had no idea when they would be up, and to just 'sit in the lobby'. Really? No Plan B? No going to the rooms to see which had been cleaned? No timeframe? I don't blame the young staff at the front desk, but this is a serious customer service faux pas. After a group of us sat for an hour, someone 'escalated' and things started to roll. Hotel is clean, modern, and overall a good value. Not near subways which is a drawback but that's why the price is resonable. Overall a pleasant place to stay with great views. If they fixed some of the easy to fix things like the Customer Service, it could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: SCLDN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, and got engaged in one of the rooms! The hotel had great views over the river and the rooftop restaurant was lovely - breakfast was great. The hotel was clean and spacious, and well-located. We walked everywhere from the hotel. Didn't have much interaction with the staff, and it was quite expensive, but we were happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: IsabelOh
Reviews.Content: Booked one night here at the very last minute to be on time for an early morning appointment at a nearby hospital the next day. I wasn't sure at all what to expect and we were limited to a few hotels in walking distance to our doctor. (I don't think this is a great location for the everyday tourist, however.) We were upgraded to a 1BR suite which was very nice. We did not have a river view but the York Ave view at night was still very pretty from the 9th floor. We paid $175 via Orbitz with a 5% discount for booking via mobile app. Ordered room service due to the late hour which was good, but nothing special. If I had one complaint the sheets smelled overly of bleach which took a little bit of getting used to when first climbing into bed. Decor was very nice and modern. Some street noise which has to be expected in New York, yes, even on the Upper East Side. I sleep with earplugs in PA so just carried them with me here. Gorgeous view at breakfast in the morning of the 59th St bridge at sunrise. Stood there with my coffee for quite a few minutes just taking it all in before we had to go. Staff was exceedingly friendly and really impressed us just being so very nice... not overly effusive, just plain nice. When I called to verify the reservation and also explain we'd be a late arrival, I was cautioned to be careful because the weather had turned ugly. When we arrived everyone we came into contact with (front desk, doorman, room service) was just a pleasure to deal with. Numerous good restaurants in the area. Great water pressure in the bathroom. They do not have on-site parking but if you're going up to the hospital you can park up at Sloan-Kettering for $32 up to 24 hours and walk the 4 blocks down. While I hope I don't have the same reason to go back to the UES, we would gladly stay again at the Bentley if the opportunity arose. Great value and charm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for location!”
Reviews.Author: Gertztrisha
Reviews.Content: Service was ok, rooms were large for Mannhattan standards. Decor was modern so by definition is dated already. Bed was large and in separate room from the rest of suite. Room was located on 2nd floor so traffic was quite loud due to proximity. Rooftop Lounge is large with a great view. Service was lackluster.

Reviews.Title: “A Dishonest Hotel: Don't Trust Them With Your Packages”
Reviews.Author: honkywanderer
Reviews.Content: The room was a good value -- a lot of space and a good view. The bigger issue I have with this hotel, however, is they are untrustworthy with packages and don't have your back if there is an issue. I had about six packages sent to the hotel and two of them were missing. Curiously the most marketable and expensive were the ones which could not be accounted for (a Kindle Fire and Photoshop CS5 software). The custody of these packages by the Bell Hop employees was dishonest. If you have anything of value I recommend that you have all your ducks in line before picking them up as the hotel has an incompetent log-in and custody procedures. First make sure you have all your tracking numbers provided by the carrier with the specific number of boxes in each shipment and the contents of each package specified. Then OPEN THE PACKAGE IN FRONT OF THE BELL HOP and write down the contents of each package and have the employee sign the paper. With this in-person verification you have a better case to make if something is missing. My mistake was trusting that all the hotel employees would be honest but this what not the case with the Bentley. The front desk night manager took charge of my complaint and went through the motions of trying to locate the package but to no avail. (The night manager claimed he didn't recognize the name of the person who signed for a 'FedEx' delivery -- I had to point out to him the unlikelihood that a bell hop would sign for an Amazon Parcel labeled 'Amazon Fire' with his real name if he intended to steal it -- duh.) The Bentley offered no compensation. The front desk day manager claimed "We have NEVER lost a package." Laughable; they lost two of mine. In contrast five days later the Gem Hotel in NYC's SoHo had all ten packages I had on hold neatly stacked and waiting in my room for me. Sure the rooms at the Gem were tiny compared to the Bentley, but I will take their honest service over the creepy treatment at the Bentley.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality”
Reviews.Author: ml m
Reviews.Content: I was told it would be $20 to park our car in their garage overnight by the front desk and when we arrived we were told there was no parking garage and we would have to drive up the street and pay at least $30. The furniture was poor quality, they put us in a room with a view; but the view was of a giant rooftop pipe and gravel walkway, we had to close our shades. There is no insulation in the walls and we could hear everything going on in the room next door to us. The housekeeping staff never bothered to check the alarm clock and after a night of interrupted sleep we were woken up by the alarm at 5 am. The restaurant staff couldn't keep up with the brunch crowd and we arrived to the brunch to barely any food left in the buffet. Very disappointed. We will never go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJS_10
Reviews.Content: The Bentley Hotel is a small boutique style hotel about a 20 minute walk from times square. We had a Junior Suite which was large and well equipped. Friendly staff and well worth considering if you can get a bargain. Only thing missing was a refridgerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bentley â€“ where everybody knows your name”
Reviews.Author: NatDerwin
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m a British Film maker, and I came to NYC for 3 months (Sept â€“ Dec 2011) to Produce a film at New York Film Academy. Friend from London recommended Bentley Hotel. The Hotels wonderful staff made me feel completely at home from the moment Iâ€™ve stepped out of the cab. The vibe of the Hotel Lobby is Cool and Sheek. Rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. My bed felt as comfortable as if I was at home. Hotelâ€™s housekeeping stuff does everything to make you feel comfortable. No request is too big or too small. Its very clean. The best part of my day was Breakfast: good selection of hot, cold dishes and fresh fruit. Imagine: starting your day with the breath-taking view of a Queensborough Bridge over Hudson River and Manhattan shining in the morning sun! What a way to start the day! Location of Bentley shouldnâ€™t put you off: Its only 10 min walk to the nearest subway (60th and Lex) New Yorkers walk a lot, and if youâ€™d like to live like a real New Yorker for a while â€“ walk â˜º Iâ€™ve seen a lot of movie and TV series being made in the area. The area is very residential, lots of good bars and quality restaurants. Itâ€™s safe and very friendly neighbourhood. Shopping: great shops on 3d, Lexington Avenues â€“ only 10 min walk. Central Park â€“ 15 min walk. I would like to say a Special Thank You to Bentleyâ€™s wonderful stuff: Alex, Sasha, Ella, Maria â€“ sorry if I havenâ€™t mentioned you all. This are very friendly, helpful and incredibly hard working people. You are always greeted with a genuine smile and feel welcome. Doorman will always help you with your heavy shopping bags, offer an umbrella if it rains. If not for you guys, my film probably wouldnâ€™t â€˜ve been made. I would recommend staying at the Bentley to anyone, who would like to feel at home during your stay in Big Apple. Thank you Bentley for a wonderful, stress â€“ free experience! Iâ€™ve felt like a spoiled Royalty â˜º The only thing I would improve - is to hire a better Chef. Hotel like Bentley - deserves only the best! So, Mr. Ramsay - if you're reading this .. ;-) Warmest Regards Nat Derwin Writer/director/Producer London UK

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bentley”
Reviews.Author: C D
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Waldorf and thought it would be fun to try something completely different. Realized we were paying the extra amount per night for the lobby. The Bentley is contemportary, immaculate, roomy (for NYC) and friendly. It is intimate. Easy travel to Central Park, Fifth Ave, and is right by the FDR for travel downtown. The 8 block walk to Central Park is envigorating and easy. We had a high floor and did not hear traffic noise even once. We had a great city view and a view of the East River. If we were on the other side of the hotel, we would have had a great view of the bridge and tram. Next time we will ask for this view. We plan to stay at the Bentley again and we look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Author: CINDY W
Reviews.Content: Came to New York for the Holidays and wanted to see all the sights, the room was clean. However the A/C didn't work the Heat didn't work, the thermostat wasn't even wired in the room. We stayed 3 mights and called maintenance 6 times for issues, then of the three elevators one was broken and it a long wait the elevators were old or something not high speed by any means. Then we had dogs barking, they weren't even allowed on our floor but we were kept up all night. Drama when my digital camera came up missing! But the memory card was left in my jewelry bag? Another person in our room had her ipod stolen. Had to file a police report, no plans to stay here again! They should want to make it right with us.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel on the UES”
Reviews.Author: sincladk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very nice stay at the Bentley Hotel on the Upper East Side of Manhattan in December 2011. In general, the room was very nice. Below are some comments about the accommodations: It was the usual New York City-sized hotel room (smallish), but it made good use of the space. They had a flat-screen TV in the room, though it's not hooked up to any HD sources, so the picture quality is not the best. The shower is enclosed using a half-wall, instead of a curtain or shower doors. This makes for a wet bathroom floor, but otherwise was not a problem. Each room has its own thermostat, and very easily controlled the climate of the room. It was always comfortable. The internet connection was not free ($10/day ish) and not the fastest, either. I averaged about 50Kb/sec during heavy usage. The elevators are SLOW. The staff is very friendly. They made food recommendations and were very accommodating, even when our room wasn't ready by check-in time. The location of the hotel is OK. It was within walking distance of the subway, and there's a bus stop less than a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.....Not great.......Indifferent”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleTripster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bentley hotel (3 girlfriends) after deciding to meet in NYC from 2 different countries (UK and OZ). The main reason in staying at the Bently was price to be perfectly honest, as we had to choose somewhere that suited my girlfriends 7 nights stay in NYC as compared to my 4 nights. The hotel looked good on the website, and after reading further reviews on tripadvisor we decided to go for it, as we were certain that we would be out most of the time anyway. The hotel is not bad, its a re-spruced office block and from the outside it looks it! Internally it could do with a little TLC but overall not bad at all, certainly good enough for a NYC base, clean, comfy beds and walking distance to many of the must see landmarks. The downsides were for me....there are definately bedbugs! Although I hear this is the norm in NY?? Also it is quite noisy, again not a huge deal - take some ear plugs as I did as I had read it was noisy, and dont bother with the 'rooftop' bar, expensive and pretty rubbish by NYC cocktail standards! Would I go again....If I was on a budget then yes, there is nothing terrible about The Bentley, but if I was going to splash the cash on hotels in NYC then no...I'd check into The Standard!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Targetsea
Reviews.Content: The Bentley provides clean, comfortable, modern rooms. Decent space. Comfortable beds and pillows. Nice bathrooms. Front desk service is friendly and helpful. And all this for $120 a night when I was staying over Christmas. But that is about it. There is an Italian restaurant on top of the hotel, with nice views of the East River. You can order dishes from there for your room in the evening. But there are no other amenities or services. There is a small lobby bar. Breakfast, served in the somewhat bleak top floor restaurant, is $17.50 and expensive for what it is. You'd be better off in a local diner. Internet connection is $10 per day. The hotel is over by FDR drive - just be the East River on the Upper East Side. So rather out of the way and rather a fuddy-duddy part of town. Convenient for the hospital though. That said, The Bentley is the smartest 'value' hotel I have stayed in in Manhattan and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Let us down”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Bentley Hotel and were a bit let down. We have stayed at The Bentley several times before and have had great experiences; very similar to others on this site. Great hotel, reasonabled priced for Manhattan, which is why we keep going back. The rooftop bar at The Bentley has always been a draw for us. After a long day in the city it is always nice to relax with an afterdinner drink and take in the beautiful view of the city. This trip however was different. First of all, we are used to having a parking garage there. This year to our surprise their on-site parking garage was closed. We had a very difficult time finding a parking garage nearby that wasn't full. We finally did find one only a few blocks away. Secondly, when we went upstairs for our evening drink at the rooftop bar we were very disappointed. My husband's glass had lipstick all over it. We also overheard another couple say they had lipstick on their glass as well. We told our waiter and he offered to bring another drink over but at this point we were just ready to return to our room for the night. We asked him to remove the charge from our bill. When we got back to our room we realized that he removed the wrong drink.....a drink costing less money. We felt like he just ripped us off. This isn't the Bentley Hotel that we were familiar with. Also, when we returned to our room (which was freezing when we initially arrived) it was freezing cold still. We adjusted the thermostat hours earlier but it never made is past 62 degrees. Though we've had many good experiences at The Bentley Hotel previously, we believe that after this experience we might start looking at one of the other hundreds of hotels in NYC for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “good all-round option for staying on Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: bubish
Reviews.Content: easy to get to, great location, quiet surroundings, courteous staff, clean rooms, We asked for late check out - .receptionist quick answer: no problem.. Very pleased with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: RiBa_100
Reviews.Content: I usually stay 30 to 40 days a year in New York and this is the best boutique hotel in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: EBrune
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with family and our 9 month old. We booked two rooms for all of us. We were given a fantastic room in the corner on one of the higher floors. Huge windows looking down on a dog park and the street below. We also had views of the river. Beautiful at night. We had a large room with a separate bedroom. All lush interiors and beautifully decorated. The other room in our party was pretty small but comfortable. Seems to be typical of NYC. The staff was extremely nice and accommodating while we were looking for things to do and nearby grocery stores (a bit of a walk south, but there is a large grocery store, starbucks, etc.). This hotel is not in the center of things, but was in a good location for the price. There are some nice restaurants and sports bars in the neighborhood and we were able to walk to MSKCC. Definitely get a room on a higher floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Convinient”
Reviews.Author: smurfettesmurfy
Reviews.Content: Myself & my boyfriend stayed at this hotel during our visit to New York in September 2011. Great place, convinient for the Metro only about a 10 min walk to Lexington Avenue. Staff were very helpful & friendly. Rooms are quite big & clean we got a great deal on this hotel & was well worth the money. There is a bar at the top of the hotel which offers the most amazing views of the Queensboro Bridge, the only downside was that it didn't seem to open until quite late evening so after a day's sightseeing we were a little disappointed that we could not finish the afternoon in the bar. The only other gripe is the lifts!!! We were on the 15th floor and it took so long for the lift to arrive once you call it!! We would have to call the lift 3 / 4 mins before wanting to leave just so it was there once we were ready! Other than that it was a great hotel & was very good in terms of location.

Reviews.Title: “It all depends where they put you....”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: ..... we weren't so lucky. We were placed on the second floor, directly above what was something like an all-night convenience store. Super depressing to look out the window-- we kept curtains shut. There was, however, a fair amount of noise. Asked for room to be changed, and they said the only thing they had was a smoking room. This seems to be common at some hotels-- they place you in the worst room on the lowest floor and when you ask to change rooms, there's only smoking rooms available. Perhaps only extremely Coincidentally, this usually happens when the hotel stay is booked through an internet discount carrier. Often, The Bentley comes up as a low-cost internet choice. It is probably because of the location-- far to the east-- right next to the FDR Drive, aka, the highway. If you have one of the higher floors, either looking out over the river or Manhattan, I am sure it is very nice. The lobby is cool-- a lot of modern style furniture in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, staff extremely unhelpful, rooms noisy.”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeet111
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel with rude staff! We were positioned on the 17th floor where we had no hot water. We advised reception, who told us just to run the tap for a while and we would get hot water. Eventually after half an hour we go hot water. We complained every day of the stay where they kept telling us it was fixed. On complaining to the manager again she said her staff had checked it and said we had hot water so we must be lying!! She compensated us with a free buffet breakfast all of which was overcooked and disgusting... The rooms are very noisy and you can hear conversations of other guests and housekeeping staff. The hotel is positioned near a hospital and a busy intersection and you hear sirens and traffic constantly! On asking reception for a transfer to the airport the next day they informed me they didnt offer this service. the next day when checking out the bell boy asked if we had transport booked or if he wanted reception to book it for us. we informed him that we had been told we couldn't book the transport, he informed us this was wrong and they could. Staff do not want to help you! Manager unfriendly and rude. Service the worst I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “A joke”
Reviews.Author: Abbeyk88
Reviews.Content: What a joke this hotel is so overpriced its actually laughable. Too start is miles away from everywhere you want to visit, u have to pay for taxis or get the subway unless u want very sore souls on your feet, the rooms are tiny I mean the littlest I've ever stayed in, the bed is obviously little in the small room, the sockets don't work to plug ur iron in then when u balance it in that does not work, with sockets not working you can't dry ur hair with the hair dryer or anything, moving on to the shower an bath oh the fun of them, the plug doesn't work in the bath an as for the shower you have freezing cold or burny hot take your pick. So to summarise, this hotel is overpriced, out of the way, very scruffy, the shower an bath don't work also the sockets oh and just to add the view is awful looking into other peoples apartments because there's a big cloth blind, if you want to be ripped off an sorely disappointed then the Bentley is definitely for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont be fooled by the pictures or good reviews”
Reviews.Author: stefalcy
Reviews.Content: this is my first ever review on a hotel and it is a honest and accurate one. i feel the need to inform other people/travellers/tourists so they don't make the same mistake me and my fiancÃ©e made when booking this hotel (THE BENTLEY NYC). right were to start, firstly this hotel is not in a good location if you don't mind walking a lot or getting taxis or using the subway then its fine. The hotel comes across as classy and stylish but its the complete opposite its small, shabby, dated and very morbid. The views are exaggerated and played on to attract custom. The rooms are so tiny and the interior is scruffy, the bathroom is disgusting and the shower is from 1950's the bed is also very small. I believed the hype and reviews and was badly let down so don't make the mistake we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 21acog
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, stayed during thanksgiving last year and got an excellent deal...the rooms were excellent...a nice boutique hotel on the upper east side..though the surrounding area was boring to say the least, it's still refreshing to have quiet, in a noisy city like NYC...the staff was extremely pleasant ..and even got a complimentary bottle of wine from the manager ..was very sweet of them...for the price..this was an excellent hotel...and will definitely return and stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Ardbeg98
Reviews.Content: Located on E. 62nd hard by the FDR Drive, the Bentley offers good accommodations at a reasonable costs. From a look at the outside and lobby, one might think that the rooms were nothing special. But this is not true. Our room was a beautiful small suite with stylish modern furnishings. Flat screens in each room were nice. The only downside that we could see in our brief stay was that the location was not a quiet one. The street noise below and the noise from the FDR Drive might be distracting to light sleepers. Otherwise, friendly service and nice rooms at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy H
Reviews.Content: One stay has made this my first choice whenever in NY. Serene lobby and staff were a pleasant welcome after a long day. But, even better was our room's view of the Queensboro bridge at night. Beautiful! Thank you Bentley for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a cheap price, centrally!”
Reviews.Author: MatsogTora
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner was looking for a central hotel for an OK price. Bentley proved to be a good choice in terms of both location and price.

Reviews.Title: “A very lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: I stay at The Bentley when my husband has surgery at Sloan Kettering. The staff has always been wonderful. I find the restraunt to have the most beautiful city view and descent food . My room is lovely. The view of the river and the bridge often take the sting out of what can be tough days for me. I think this hotel is a great place to stay at any time.

Reviews.Title: “new years' eve”
Reviews.Author: MIRY
Reviews.Content: Convenient price (for 8 days across the new years' eve) and conveniently located, 10 minutes on foot from the subway. Beautiful view on the Queensboro bridge from the rooftop restaurant. Very comfortable bed, also for the room. The heat was a but noisy. Good cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lindstravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bentley Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of October. It should be noted that the price of this hotel was significantly less than other hotels in New York so my expectations were relatively low. I was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel was nicely decorated in the main areas. The room was more than adequate for a short stay. My only criticism being that the bathroom was in need of attention. The sink was cracked although this did not prevent it from functioning. But any small faults can be forgiven as the crowning glory of this hotel really is the roof-top terrace with a fantastic view of the Queensboro Bridge, which was especially beautiful at night. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: Magrithea
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a week's stay at the Bentley, on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. It's conveniently located for the subway (3 blocks from Lexington and 59th station, if you don't mind the walk, and the subway station is right next to Bloomingdales!) and we had a room with a great view of the East River and the Queensboro bridge - better than the first we were allocated which, when we opened the door, appeared to have already been occupied, with two cases in the room and other indications of someone else being in residence! Not what you want after a long flight and trip in from JFK! The room was fine, nice big bed with crisp sheets, compact bathroom adequately stocked though, as usual with most hotels, the towels could have been a bit bigger! The staff were friendly and helpful, so far, so good. Niggles about the hotel were: - our room had two windows, being on the corner; one had a good, Roman style, fabric blind while the other had two Venetian, slat, blinds. Not a problem you'd think, except that the window with the Venetian blind faced the east so as soon as the sun was up, we were woken! We were told the room had been recently renovated so why didn't someone think of putting the heavier blind on both windows? Also, in the process of renovating, the in-room fridge seemed to have been removed and not replaced and there were no tea/coffee making facilities though this might be common in all NY hotels. - the heating/cooling system was terrible! It was unseasonably warm for our visit (early November) and when we arrived the room was like a sauna, far too hot but we couldn't get the system to blow cold air. We called reception who sent up a maintenance man who 'fixed' the problem, saying it would cool down soon; it didn't! We opened windows and turned the system off. By the next day we couldn't stand it so called for help again - this time the maintenance man did solve the problem (though he had to take the front of the unit off to do it) and we were happy until a cooler day towards the end of the week. We selected heating mode on the control panel and set a temperature but only got cold air! Yet another maintenance man had to come to reset to heating. We gave up when the weather warmed up again the next day and just left the system off and opened windows to cool the room!! - on the subject of windows - we were on the 20th floor but the windows could be fully opened, just a bit alarming! - Internet access was chargeable (minimum $10 per 24 hours, cheaper if you bought more time) but I could not get my notebook to connect. A helpful call to the tech guys seemed to do the trick, but only if I took the computer outside the room, to the lift lobby to connect. It would then randomly drop the connection sometimes and stay connected for quite a while at others. The only good thing was the fact that I seemed to be able to connect for free!!! - finally, the only breakfast options were a hot and cold breakfast in the 21st floor dining room for $17.95 (plus, no doubt, tax) or the lobby coffee corner which was 'proudly brewing' Starbucks coffee and serving a few pastries, juices and sandwiches. The coffee might be Starbucks brand but certainly not as good as the stuff they serve in the branches! We had the best breakfast in the Ritz Diner, about 2 blocks west but only found it on the 2nd to last day! ALSO THE GRIM COFFEE IN THE LOBBY V THE RIP OFF COST OF BREAKFAST!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: calgrads
Reviews.Content: New York was very busy when we tried to find a hotel for a business trip. My usual favorites were booked. My colleague found the Bentley because the price was reasonable, although certainly not inexpensive, and they still had rooms available. I would probably never stay there again, or recommend it to anyone. The hallways were dusty, there was mold in the bathroom, the shower leaked, the drains were very slow, the room decor was dated and unappealing and the location was farther than we wanted to be from the subway. My colleague had trouble accessing the wifi in her room and the "Business Center" (almost a joke) charged $2.00 to print my boarding pass! The service was good, but it didn't make up for all of the other shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathy D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bentley and were very happy. Upon arrival our room was not ready - we received a complimentary upgrade to a suite on the 18th floor. Couldn't have been more happy. Our room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very helpful and pleasant - willing to please - during the Noreaster it was difficult to flag down a taxi - the doorman stood on the corner for quite some time to get us a taxi so we weren't exposed to the elements. Thank you Bentley for a pleasant weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “You know you are in New York”
Reviews.Author: Pom H
Reviews.Content: I chose the Bentley as it was a short walk to Sotheby's where I was working for a couple of days. It is right over on the East side on York. Any walk to mid town is a hike of at least 10 - 15 minutes. The room was recently refurbished and I had a corner suite with spectacular views from the 18th floor. I think the bathroom and in particular the shower was poor, especially for a $450 a night suite. The bar / restaurant at the top is blessed with a specaular view of the east side of Manhatten and the 59th Street Bridge. Being next to the FDR and the Bridge there is a serious amount of traffic and is therefore noisy, not for light sleepers. Breakfast was average with basic buffet. In short, happy to have tried it, enjoyed the views, but i think there are better value hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value!”
Reviews.Author: HandGsDad
Reviews.Content: We got a room at this hotel for a steal on Hotwire and were delighted with the resulted. The Good: The lobby is modern and clean. The room was spacious, modern, and comfortable. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. High-quality bath products The Not-So-Good: It's kinda far from everything. Central Park is a 25 min walk, Times Square, 45 min Elevators are very slow. Overall though, a big win. Loved the housekeeping staff as well. I'd easily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BSL68
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay recently at the Bentley Hotel. Nice boutique hotel, exceptionally friendly and helpful staff, very clean, decent-sized room for NYC, good location. Lots of good restaurants and a great little pub nearby, 10-min walk to Central Park, 20-min (walking quickly) to Times Square. Our room had cool views of the bridge, the river, Roosevelt Island, and the tram. Did not try the restaurant. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Brisa03
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two nights and the Bentley and have no complaints. The rooms were clean and every single staff person was quite pleasant. Yes it is a bit of a stroll to the subway, but it was also nice discovering the food emporium under the 59th St bridge and the movie theatre just a block away. Its not fancy and my wallet appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time was had”
Reviews.Author: suemothergoosemackay
Reviews.Content: went to New york as a 50th birthday treat with my cousin and we couldnt have picked a nicer, friendly hotel, the staff were very obliging, even helped us with places to go and eat, the rooftop restaurant was superb, the staff were very wonderful and made sure we had everything we needed, the manager peter was very proffesional and went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect, cant praise the staff here enough , will be returning next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: orthodoc495
Reviews.Content: To give some background, I have travelled extensively for both business and vacation to many places in the world over the years and have never once stayed at a hotel that was so bad that I felt the need to write a review on tripadvisor. That changed after my wife and I stayed at the Bentley while in NYC on business. We chose the Bentley because it was in the area of Manhattan that we wanted to stay in and the pictures on the website looked great. I will start with the positives: 1. Decent location 2. Rooms clean and modern and we had a great view of the city through large windows 3. Polite and helpful doormen That's where the good ends and the bad begins: 1. My wife and I had booked a non-smoking room with a king bed and were told when we showed up that we had to either settle for a room with a king bed on the smoking floor or a room with 2 double beds. We settled on the room with 2 double beds due to the horrendous smell on the smoking floor and ended up having to sleep in separate beds the entire trip because both of us could not fit into their tiny version of a double bed (and we are average-sized people). 2. The TV in the room did not work. We were told this was a "building problem" and nothing was done about it. Luckily we were in NYC so we rarely wanted to watch TV, but we couldn't even watch the news or sports scores. 3. Since it was a business trip for me, we paid upfront for 3 days of internet and the internet did not work for half that time, and we were again told that his was a "building problem" and nothing was done about it. 4. The iron in the room was scorched and left marks on my my dress pants. When trying to inquire with the manager about cleaning them, we were told the hotel had no in-house laundry and they tried to offer us a free breakfast in exchange from my pants being ruined. They were eventually convinced into trying to clean my pants and taking the cost of the pants of our bill if they could not be cleaned. 5. While I was at a meeting, my wife had breakfast alone at the hotel and charged it to the room. They billed us for 2 buffet breakfasts and when the error was pointed out, insisted that my wife had paid in cash for 2 people and that no refund would be offered. This was worsened by the fact that the food had been terrible. All in all, a terrible place to stay and I would advise any traveller visiting NYC to steer clear of this hotel. The owners or ownership group would be well advised to clean house of their management staff and bring in new people who have experience in properly running a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for a week long stay in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveLombok
Reviews.Content: I took my husband for a week to New York City as he had never been and I knew a couple of days would be too rushed when there is so much to see! This hotel fitted the bill in terms of price and location - it is a good 20 min walk to the centre of Manhattan but once we left the hotel we were out all day so it really didn't matter than it wasn't really central. The hotel itself had a fantastic view from the bar/ restaurant on the roof, looking over the Queensborough Bridge on one side. We enjoyed great cocktails there one evening. I must say a personal thank you to Helena Blat the general manager there who made our stay so special with little extra touches - some of which I did ask for in advance - but didn't expect such a high level of customer service :) The room itself was the size you would expect in NYC - we were quite pleasantly surprised as it wasn't as tiny as some reviews had led us to believe! We only heard the people in the next room 2 days out of 7 - which was only because there was a connecting door between the two. I would recommend this hotel for young couples or anyone who doesn't mind the refreshing walk to the tube - although equally if you plan to catch cabs everywhere it is a spot on location. There is an amazing traditional American diner one block away and Bloomingdale's is within walking distance also. Overall a good place to stay - we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Neither bad nor brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: petsaloz
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after an internet search. There were mixed comments on TripAdvisor but the negatives (parking costs, restaurant promotion and distance from Central Park etc) did not concern us. Other comments were positive. We confirmed our booking as suggested by the manager responding to a tripadvisor comment. Arrived at 3.10 pm as advised to find the room was not ready. After a few minutes I mentioned the previous email conversation with the manager and a room was available with upgrade. The hotel is older and the external appearance is a bit off-putting. Inside is better but the need for refurbishment is evident. The room was spacious and everything worked OK. The A/C unit was noisy but we put up with it in case a relocation meant the original room which we were certain would be much smaller. The bed was comfortable and the room roomy enough to enjoy a meal in the room at the table. There is a good food market close under Queensboro bridge that sells prepared salads etc. The bathroom was very small. Stay here again? Probably not. The crowning point was when I asked for help to get a taxi to go to Penn Station at 6.00 am. Response was basically my problem. The doorman was more enterprising and earned his tip.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, comfortable bed, trendy decor”
Reviews.Author: Janet F
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty nice little hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable with plenty of extra bedding and pillows. The staff was reasonably friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was nothing special but the rooftop bar was nice. We stayed here on a quick weekend retreat and would definitely come back. The room was on the small side, but it is in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Clean scent all over hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TigerBunnie
Reviews.Content: You know how some hotels can have an awkward smell? Well this one doesn't. It stayed fresh my entire stay. I love this place! The beds are comfy and rooms are stylish and functional! I love it here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for an escape”
Reviews.Author: FtWayne_INPam
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel due to AARP recommending it. It was an easy walk to Central Park. A movie theatre is 2 blocks away. The views from the rooftop dining are fantastic. Bus stop is two blocks away, subway about 3. Service was excellent. Bed was very nice. Room was in good condition. Price was right. Hudson river and Queensboro bridge are beautiful at night from there. We would go back anytime we go to New York. Cab fare to our cruise pier was only $11.00 for all of us. Not bad. Beats parking.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Wedding gathering”
Reviews.Author: Azepoloeyes
Reviews.Content: I booked this room because it was close to where my daughter was staying. To my surprise, the outside wasn't impressive but inside, the doormen, reservation agents were all very polite, helpful and kind. The decor of the lobby was clean comfortable and inviting. My room looked like the ones in the photo. Very clean, nice colors, upscale bedding although the rug was damp when I walked in, guess they cleaned the carpets with too much water. Bathroom was clean, shower was great and the free toiletries smelt amazing. Otherwise, the location was EXCELLENT, 10 min walk to subways, nice stores, local resturants. I felt safe walking home from the subways and bus stations. The bonus was having a car ready for a price to take me to the airport instead of lugging my suitcases through the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Avoid the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Thaddaway
Reviews.Content: I was having outpatient surgery in NY and chose the Bentley for it's proximity to the hospital. To begin out two-night stay, we were greeted warmly by the friendly and helpful front-desk staff. Our room was bright, clean and had a great view of the bridge and East River. The hotel's service was mixed: housekeeping responded within five minutes when we asked to exchange pillows, but the front-desk never made the requested wake-up call the following morning. The restaurant's food and service, at least for breakfast, was awful. A buffet featuring soggy, oily bacon; stale granola; and assorted cold cereals, instant oatmeal, and "hot" eggs and pancakes, was less than I'd expect for $18. When my husband asked if the "chef" could crisp up the back, he was given a flat-out, rude "no." Would we stay again? I'm not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and not bad for a NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveStars28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were combing through reviews before we decided on staying at the Bentley Hotel for 3 nights. It is totally out of the way when it comes to the main attractions but it was also nice to be amongst native New Yorkers. The room was a lot roomier than expected and the bathroom was decent as well. It is a good 10-15 min walk to the nearest subway and about a 15-20 minute was to Central Park. If you are going to spend most of your time in SoHo or Times Square then I suggest booking another hotel. However, if you want a quite hotel away from the grit of the city then this is a nice hotel. As for the updating of the hotel decor, "Who Cares?" It was clean and there were no mystery stains on linens or flooring and that's all I can ask for. I would stay at the Bentley Hotel again. On a different note, there is an amazing diner about 2 blocks away and on 60th and 1st there is a delicious Italian restaurant names Angels. (Don't quote me on the name I could be wrong.) None the less the food portions were huge and the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: maryru
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 3pm our room was ready. The room on the 17th floor, had a view of the city. There was ample space for the 2 of us. I think it would have been cramped with 4. Being on the 17th floor we had to turn on the shower a few minutes before we needed it each morning. This was a first for us. But once the water was hot the shower was great. The only negative I had about the room was the bath linens. We were there for 5 days. Some days we had a bath mat, some days we had enough towels, and some days we had enough face cloths. Iâ€™m not sure what the problem was but we never talked to the management about this problem. We left each day at 8 am and didnâ€™t return until about 9-10 each evening. We were visiting our son who lived 12 blocks from the hotel. We found that leaving the fan on each night gave us a good nights sleep without much street noise. The rooms were quiet as were the floors. Our room that was located in front of the elevators and we never heard any noise for quests. We enjoyed our stay and will be returning in a few weeks for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, food and drinks”
Reviews.Author: Chloe4travel
Reviews.Content: Looved the ambience - roof top and view of entire NYC from the balcony Food - delicious Drinks - strong but good Price - reasonable Service - could be better

Reviews.Title: “A great find --not too far, but a little removed from the madding crowds!”
Reviews.Author: LaSagradaFamilia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Bentley very recently, during Hurricane Irene's visit to the Big Apple. So it wasn't that our expectations were somewhat lowered, but considering what the experience could have been, it exceeded our expectations. We were accommodated in one of several large rooms that were being held for parents and students coming to Marymount Manhattan College and conveniently located between the apartment house/dorm for the students and the college itself. The rate was extremely reasonable for the upper East Side. Nearby was a fabulous Bed, Bath and Beyond for outfitting the student rooms. The views of the East River from our room was outstanding, especially after the storm blew through! Because the subway and transit systems were closed down, and workers could not get into the city, the rooftop restaurant was closed the weekend of the hurricane. But the hotel provided a complimentary continental breakfast for those "trapped" at the hotel. Overall it was a great experience and I will definitely return to The Bentley!

Reviews.Title: “So, so disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: kacki_8
Reviews.Content: I am the sister referenced in the review by Deni22, dated May 2, 2011. My sister and I spent many hours reviewing tripadvisor and other sites to pick a hotel for our 3 night stay in the city. We chose the Bentley because my sister had stayed in the hotel in the past and was pleased at that time and because they offered a smoking room. To say that we were disappointed is an understatement. The basic negatives are: 1- Run down hotel in great need of up-fitting. 2- Coffee available in the lobby at off hours but only available in the roof top restaurant in the morning. 3- Broken towel racks, shower rods in the rooms. 3- Scratched furniture. 4- Expensive taxi ride to broadway. Actually, it should have been a big clue to us that 2 taxi drivers had to 'google' the hotel to find the address! As a hotel owner myself I can say it is hard to please everyone all the time. However, you have to try. I was truely astounded by the hotels lack of effort to make us happy. The response by the manager stating we never asked for a smoking room and when offered one , chose a higher floor instead is totally false and very representative of the attitude we experienced at the time. We most certainly asked for a smoking room at reservation and were told that they could not guarantee individual requests. So...I get that. But, when we asked at check in time if they had a smoking room and were told that there was not one available for that night, but we could have one for the next two nights, we were disappointed, but understood. The next morning I called the front desk and was told very rudely that there was not a smoking room available for that night OR the next, that there was no record of that request. No apologies, no attempt to make up for their error in not putting the hold on the room for us. Nothing! I wonder if the person at the front desk just wanted to 'pass the buck' by telling us we could have one the next night. Anyway, we resigned ourselves to our room and set out enjoy the rest of our stay. We found that there was only one hand towel and no washclothes. We called the desk and were told that they would bring some to us. After an hour, we called back, asked about the towels and also asked for some ice. After another hour we called back and told them to FORGET the ice, to just bring the towels! Maybe asking for 2 different things was too much for them to handle. I understand the construction and the noise, the hotel cannot help their location and they do have to do the work required for upkeep. We do the same thing at our hotel. However, I also know that making a guest happy with their stay should be the focus of the entire staff from housekeeping through the managers. I think the snotty attitude of the front desk staff and the arrogance of the front desk manager is indicative of a persuasive negativity and no remodeling or advertising can overcome this. Until the attitude changes and the staff realizes that the patrons are the only reason they have a job there is NO reason to choose this hotel in a city that is blessed with a great many wonderful hotels. And ..Oh Yeah...the 'manger' said " Go ahead and find another hotel if you don't like this one" WOW! If anyone at our little hotel said this to a guest without doing everything they could to make the guest happy they would be out of a job.

Reviews.Title: “...not great, but fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Gailmo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and feel it is an OK place in NYC. The rooms are fairly large, they are clean and provide the basics. The beds are wonderful. The location is fine...but it is a 10 minute walk to the nearest subway stop. Restaurants on first street (one block away) are amazing....a wide variety and good quality for a nice NYC meal. What bothers me about this hotel are a few things. First the walls are very thin. You can hear EVERYTHING in the rooms next door. My latest stay involved being woken up at 2am by some pretty interesting screaming next door. So bring ear plugs!! I also feel like I am "dinged" for everything at this hotel. No internet....no ice--but they will bring it up to your room and of course you need to tip. No early check-in both times I stayed. And the check in is very, very slow. They never seem to have enough people staffing the counter at the 3-5pm check-in times. No coffee or hot water pot in the rooms--you can buy it in the lobby. Overall, this is an average-good hotel. The views from the upper rooms over the river are really nice. I have not eaten in the restaurant--thus cannot comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel on east side.”
Reviews.Author: OBD2142
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an hotel on the east side, this could be a good option. It is far east at York, so if you have business on the west side, it is far. ($13-14 to Javits Center.
