I had an upgraded suite room (thank you) with fantastic views of 59 St Bridge and up/down York ave. Lots of amenities in room typical of 4 star hotel. Robes, sewing kit, shaver, toothbrush, nice soap & shampoo. NO coffee makers in room. Coffee bar downstairs in morning, not included w/room. Walls a bit thin if you have noisy room neighbors. I liked the room decor w/ zebra stripe carpet and hounds tooth pattern pillows. Small bathroom - but this is typical in New York. Pleasant staff. I'd consider this a 3 1/2 star hotel with some 4 star amenities.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Rooftop Restaurant..”
Reviews.Author: Patti and Paul G
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to eat elsewhere, but chose to dine here 4 nights and one breakfast. The food was excellent..the Ramano chicken, the veal marsala, and the ribeye steak with vegetables! The waiters were attentive as well as friendly! If we are ever back in Manhattan, we will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal for NYC”
Reviews.Author: akabond
Reviews.Content: Selected this property because of its proximity to Memorial Sloan Kettering hospital where I was having surgery the next day. When we arrived w were told that we had been upgraded to a suite. It was beautiful with a fantastic view of the East River and the 59th Street Bridge. The next days surgery went by with any problems and this is where we got our next surprise. We had dinner at the penthouse , consisting of two pasta and chicken entrees wine and coffee. Total price $44.00. Will definitely stay again. Only downside was that the parking garage was closed for repair.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: EdHK
Reviews.Content: We had mixed emotions about booking four nights at the Bentley. The location was good for our needs and the price was right but the uneven reviews in Trip Advisor caused concern. We were upgraded to a junior suite that was roomy and had a terrific view on Manhattan and the Queensboro Bridge. Although some of the furnishings were a bit worn, everything worked. The front desk staff were courteous and helpful. Our plans changed and we had to shorten our stay by one night. Our prepayment for the unused night was easily coordinated with Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “A great cost/benefit choice”
Reviews.Author: rflore77
Reviews.Content: Considering the price range of the business hotels in Manhattan it is a great choice. The location is cool although you need to walk a few blocks to get to the subway but in the middle you'll find lots of diners and coffee shops and also Bloomingdale's. The staff attention is great. They even have several menus from nearby deli places to order from. That's a big plus The only 2 things that should have been better: The breakfast brunch is too simple The A/C needs to be less noisy In general it's a great option.

Reviews.Title: “nice size clean room no service and no a/c”
Reviews.Author: CAProsecutrix
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days in town for a family wedding. The room was nice sized and the bed was really comfortable and clean but the air conditioning was terrible had to leave the shade down all the time and the room was 78 degrees - making sleeping impossible for me. The front desk is run by idiots and they did nothing in response to the complaint of no air conditioning. I finally found a maintenance guy and he put a fan in the room. Do not depend on the front desk for anything - no wake up call and my sister nearly missed her flight. Mostly everyone who works there is Russian; perhaps if you speak Russian you can get some service. The hotel is dated in decor from the 1960s. The view from the roof top is lovely. The restaurant closed on a Saturday for maintenance - extremely poor planning.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay off the tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: travelinmatecom
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel centrally located to all main sights in NYC you might want to end in the typical tourist areas around Times Square or Empire State but The Bentley. If you hate overcrowded areas and prefer to stay in a more residential area off the beaten path like me, the editor of travelin-mate.com, you should take a closer look at The Bentley. The hotel is located along the Hudson at the Upper East next to Queensboro Bridge, East River Drive, and the Roosevelt Island Tram. Its interior is very modern, the rooms are clean and compared to other cities small but this is by the way the usual case in Manhattan. If you are a light sleeper you should bring earplugs, a further disadvantage of the loud metropolis, no matter which hotel you are staying in! Bellboys, receptionists, housekeeping, and the barista at the onsite coffee shop are very attentive, polite and obliging. Unfortunately, I havenâ€™t had time to visit the top floor restaurant but the view over Roosevelt Island towards Queens, Brooklyn and Manhattan isnâ€™t bad. To enjoy the location even more ask for a high floor room during check-in. Within walking distance you have an upscale supermarket at 1st Ave and 59th St and several restaurants along 2nd Ave. A nice recommendation is Jackson Hole Burgers @ 232 E 64th St # A if you do not want to spend a fortune traveling with family or friends. Staying in The Bentley requires some walking, which I donâ€™t mind since this is in my opinion the only way to really explore NYC. If four blocks to the subway is already too much for you take a cab. I definitely will recommend The Bentley to my readers on travelin-mate.com. The only thing I would point out to the management is to offer free Wifi to guests at least in the public areas. This review was written by the editor of travelin-mate.com

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Name43
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little nervous about staying here but it turned out to be a nice place that my family and I enjoyed. My wife and I were traveling with our 3 and 6 year old and our biggest concern was that the a/c would inadequate or the noise at the hotel would keep them up. Neither was an issue, the a/c worked well and while it was a little loud it was not so much so that it kept them up. Our room was very clean, plenty of towels, etc. With respect to the city noise, well it is a city and cities can be loud. The staff was fine, professional and helpful. The room size was good for NYC, we stayed in a junior suite and it was well sized and the bathroom was away from where the kids were sleeping which was helpful. It is not "centrally" located according to some of the reviews but it is easily walking distance to Central Park, FAO Schwartz and the subway. It is true that there is no valet parking and you need to pull around the corner to park, I did not find that inconvenient. Upon showing up we dropped our bags off and I parked and when we wanted our car I ran and got it. It's literally a 20 yard walk that we did not find inconvenient. The cost is pretty steep, $30 bucks for a day but that is a reflection of NYC not the hotel. It seemed a little pricey we paid in the mid 300s for two nights but I think that is a reflection of NYC and not the hotel. One warranted criticism is the shower, it does have a half door which allows water out which many have commented on, they are correct, if a full shower door is your top criteria for a hotel don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs...Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Lkay104
Reviews.Content: I went on a trip to NY to celebrate my sister's Sweet 16. When we got to the hotel the staff were nice enough to let us check-in early. The room looked nice, but we found a few problems. The bathroom door was very difficult to shut. The shower took more than 10 minutes to get hot and the drain was stopped up. We called the front dsk about the drain and when we came back to the room they fixed that. The walls in this hotel are paper thin. You can hear people in the hallways and noise from neighboring rooms. On the website it syas they have breakfast available. However that breakfast is almost $20 per person and definitely not worth it. However all of this was minimal compared to the bed bug rashes me and my sister left with. After only staying one night our arms were covered in bed bug bites. We have never had these bites before so we did not realize what they were til we got home that evening and diagnosed ourselves by looking at pics online. For the price we paid for the room, bed bugs were not worth our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: ekay716
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for my birthday in New York. The rooms are not like they appear in pictures. The view was nice. I breakfast was not worth the cost. The biggest problem I had was the discovery of bed bug bites all over me the next day. It was horrible! I would never stay here again and pay as much as I did just to get bitten to death by bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely magnificent”
Reviews.Author: hotsharon54
Reviews.Content: The bentley was so outstanding that they even had umbrellas in the room. The location can't be beat. The staff was magnificent. The ambiance was totally luxurious. The room was remarkable and spectacular especially at night. I absolutely loved it, but what I loved most was the love you felt with the staff and especially Helena. The breakfast buffet was like no other buffet with all kinds of fresh fruit, like kiwis, big juicy sausages, fluffy pancakes, hot and cold cereal, all kinds of pastries, bagels, specialized teas and coffee, juice, fresh cream with a view of sitting on top of New york city and a staff that didn't even wait for you to ask before they had what you needed. A newspaper at every table. These people got hospitality down to a science and they loved making sure that you were pleased in every way. We were greeted with fresh fruit and blue bottles of water from new york and post cards. All I can Say is why stay anywhere else. The Bentley has 4 stars for hospitality, ambiance, location, price, comfort, style, and last but not least Helena the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: AmyCt
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a three night business stay at the Bentley. I chose it due to close proximity of hotel to a nearby hospital. I arrived around 11pm, to find that there is no car valet. You have to drive to a nearby parking garage. The parking was not $20 a day as mentioned in other reviews, but $30.00 a day. After a long walk with my bags to the front door, I entered the smoke and alcohol stench drenched lobby. I requested a high floor room, which was denied, due to "all booked up", as I listened to a caller requesting another room, which was accomadated. They took my credit card in case, "you smoke in a nonsmoking room" (I do not smoke) although my company paid in full for the three nights. The hotel The decor was nice at first glance, very trendy, animal print floors, and nice linens. However, upon entering the room, the AC was SO noisy. The room smelled of smoke, which was mixed with mold smell. The carpet was drenched with leaking airconditioner fluid. I called the front desk to let them know, and they informed me that they would send a maintence worker right away. I requested another room, and they denied me again, and told me that this is what happens when you check in at 11pm. The maintence person came, and could not fix leak, needed more tools ets. I requested he not come as I had to wake up at 6am. The front desk women were some of the rudest staff I have come across. I stayed the night, after the night manager said he would give me a much better room the next day. Next afternoon, I had to explain my story again to the hotel staff, only to be downgraded to a smaller room. Thankfully it was much cleaner. Upon check out, I called down to request a final bill. They said it would be ready by the time I got downstairs. I checked out, and requested to make sure that they did not charge my credit card for the room, and the desk person said that everything was prepaid by my company, and there is no written/ printed bill to give me. What hotel cannot print out a invoice!!! Checking my credit card statement, of course the Bentley charged my card! I am not sure if they charged the company card, but I wouldnt' put it past them. Never again will I stay or send my coworkers to stay at this sneaky, uncaring, dirty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time and a great area”
Reviews.Author: sportsnuts
Reviews.Content: The room was more than twice the size of our last stay in NYC. The area was not as hectic as Times Square and it was only 6 blocks to the subway. We went everywhere from there and walked several times to Central Park. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful and we loved the restaurant on the roof. Food and views were fantastic. Thanks Peter for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbandSteveM
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in a junior suite. The wall to wall view was fabulous. We found the hotel to be very clean and the hotel staff very helpful. It was a 20 minute walk to Central Park to catch the hop on hop off or subway, but there were city buses at the corner if you didn't want to walk that far (less than a minute from the hotel). Their parking garage was still under renovation but there was a garage half a block away that the hotel directed us to. At $30 per day it was still cheaper than a lot of places around. We only had breakfast at the hotel so I can't say what their restaurant was like. The breakfast was $19 per person and if we didn't have complimentary breakfast included we would not have eaten there for that price. There were many restaurants within walking distance to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this run-down, overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: goonertraveller2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 5 hotels - 3 of them in New York - on my most recent trip to the USA. This was comfortably the worst. Always a bad sign when the reception is dark and dingy - that's usually the smartest place in a hotel - and my room was similarly badly kept. Worse still the carpet was soaking wet - almost up to the bed from the air conditioning unit and it took major argument - and a 2 hour wait while they unsuccessfully tried to dry it - to get a room switch. By that time there were only smaller rooms available. I moved room and found no safe in the room and a connecting door that I could open. There was another door on the other side which did not have a handle on "my" side, but it would not have taken much for either of the catches to be slipped. I therefore put a chair against it and my luggage on the chair. Staff were rude and unhelpful - with the exception of Yara at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & View”
Reviews.Author: Keyla24k
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in great area, near Central Park and all the stores in 5th Ave. The staff was really nice. Room had a Great view to the beach, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom were clean, I got reservations at the last min. the price was really good. I will strongly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not super impressed”
Reviews.Author: Tianormalita
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel overall except for the distance to the closest subway: 4 long avenue blocks northeast. One more important thing, we had an issue with the shower: the water wouldn't drain properly and I ended up standing in a pool of my own bathwater. When I called them to fix it, they sent in a maintenance person who left his bootprints on the white tub and the floor towel. When I tested it again, I got to stand in a puddle of my own bathwater instead. I didn't want to call again and get the same maintenance person who was ogling my niece back into our room, so we endured making our showers the worst part of our hotel experience. I also sent for towels but they brought hand towels instead--not something that could help towel dry my long hair. I called again to complain and they sent us the right kind. Really nice place but would rather stay closer to the sights next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Impressed with the Bentley Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koch120
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife recently went to NYC for our one year anniversary. Having never been to NYC before we didn't know what to expect and picking a hotel online can be deceiving. When we got to the Bentley Hotel at 1:30 am after a 5 hr flight from San Diego, the guy at the front desk told me that we didn't have reservation there. I was shocked, I had booked and paid for this 3 months in advance!! After 30 minutes of us going back and forth, I had to dig through my luggage to show him my Reservation Confirmation. Upon looking at it, he then proceeded to tell me that he can get me a room, but he took my credit card and tried to run it for $1000 without my permission! I was livid.... I told him again that my confirmation showed that we had paid for the hotel in FULL! He had to look at it several times before he decided that we could stay for the night but might not be able to stay the rest of the weekend. On top of all this, we called several times for Ice and towels and never got it. They don't have an ice machine in the hallways. The Elevators took years to get to us on the 11th floor, it wasn't anything we imagined when we booked this. We never touched anything from the mini bar but when we checked out they tried to charge us $17 for Peanut M&M's, which we were obviously upset about. The manager apologized and told me that there wasn't anything he could do but give us a great rate if we ever came back. We'll definately be back to NYC but will never stay at the Bentley! I'd rather camp at Central park and take my chances getting mugged by a drifter...... The only bad thing about our NYC trip.....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it--will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: mkbrennan
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from 3 nights at the Bentley. It was our first time staying there and were a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. The staff was friendly and couldn't be more professional or helpful from the second we stepped out of our car. We loved the location--just walking one block up to 1st Avenue, everything is right there--restaurants, bars, shops, diners, you name it. It's a beautiful neighborhood and the local merchants are so friendly. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service andd quality at the rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: jessgabb77
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at the Bentley hotel however, we visited there due to the deal we bought on Travel Zoo. We made a reservation well in advance. when we arrived we were seated and waited 15 minutes before we even received a menu. The first order of business for the waitress was to collect our tip up front once we paid an additional $11.00 for a tip which was no where near deserved we were then able to order drinks and our appetizers. Our plan was to also stay at the restaurant for dinner however, by the end of our appetizers we had to cancel the order. It was ridiculous the service we received. After 50 minutes our waitress told us there was an issue with our order and we'd have to place our appetizer and dinner order again as it was not entered/not prepared by the kitchen. When our appetizers finally did arrive the serving size of both of them was smaller than noted in the menu. When we questioned it the waitress had to ask the manager and the manager told her to tell us it's because of the travel zoo coupon. We asked to speak to the manager but he refused to come to our table. This deal was supposed to be a discount on the regular price but we were still supposed to receive the regular menu item not a smaller serving. The coconut shrimp sauce was rancid and shrimp was disgusting and not edible. By this time we cancelled our dinner order as we just wanted to get out of there. At this time our waitress did not come back but another waiter came by to say if we wanted a refund we should contact travelzoo. then someone came by with our dinner that we just cancelled. We told them to take it back and we left. We will never return to this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jean091
Reviews.Content: Very clean & polite staff. Well located right at the Queensboro bridge, near the UN and within easy walking distance to Central Park, Rockefeller Center and other NYC sites. Excellent view of the bridge & Roosevelt Island tram from the room. Huge windows. Very comfortable beds. Breakfast & lunch eateries within a couple of blocks of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: vickie324
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and think it is a great value in NYC. Some of the rooms overlook the 59th Bridge and the East River and that is really spectacular. There is a rooftop bar/lounge that offers great drinks and views. The rooms are modern and spotless, service is great. I know it seems a little out of the way (all the way over by the river on E. 62nd) but a couple of blocks walk takes you to the bus lines on 1st Ave or 2nd Ave. I usually take taxis everywhere so location is not a big factor. And its worth it to save $$$!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the trouble...”
Reviews.Author: Always_Traveling04
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually stay here so maybe their rooms are a whole lot better than their Rooftop Restaurant and Bar. I was in the city for work for the weekend and I got a Travelzoo coupon to check out their restaurant. I thought it was a pretty good deal, four drinks and two appetizers for $39. The decor was nice but the service was horrible and the food...not worth the price and I'm glad I had a deal. We were seated in what they call their lounge area of the restaurant only to wait forever to be waited on. We had to flag a server down and multiple people would come to the table. Weren't really sure who our server was. After we finally got served, no one really checked on us. We had asked the server for our check and then decided to step outside for a minute to check out the great view. It is a rooftop now....but not a very safe one. Appears to be under construction. While we were out there, we noticed new people sitting at our table. When we came back in to ask the server, she said "oh, I thought you guys left". Um no, we were waiting for you to bring the check. Unless you have a deep discount deal, I would recommend this restaurant for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Restaurant a Disaster”
Reviews.Author: karenoid
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at the hotel; but went the the Rooftop Restaurant and Bar because of a deal I recieved through Travelzoo. This should have been a wonderful experience. The ambiance of the place is very nice; and I have to give credit to the waitstaff who all did the very best they could under horrible circumstances. Apparently the restaurant sold over 3,000 coupons that entitled the user to 4 coctails and two appetizers for a very reasonable $39 plus tax/tip. Due to this overselling, the management neglected to staff appropriately for the influx of customers. There was literally ONE waitress for 10 tables of 2-4 guests. Two other servers frantically tried to help her, but there was no way service could be good with this. We managed to get our drinks and food only because we went up to the bar, or sought out the server ourselves. The drinks were tasty, and the appetizers were fine (nothing special). But we ordered dinner as well, and it never came. Never even got into the system. Customers all around us were furious and frustrated. We had a good time only because we were happy to be chatting and catching up; and we knew what the servers must have been dealing with. Management should be ashamed. Don't sell deals if you can't prepare for them. It doesn't help bring customers if you can't serve them. Shame on the owners of this hotel for ruining a nice place with poor planning. Oh - and it would have been nice if we had been told ahead of time that the outdoor patio bar was CLOSED FOR RENOVATIONS when we went!

Reviews.Title: “I used to like the Bentley.”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorK43501
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Bentley, and I wish I'd chosen differently this time. The room was shopworn, with items that did not work, like the tv remote and the sink drain cover (important to me because I wear contacts). The air conditioner was extremely noisy and not very effective. Worst of all, when I got home, I discovered that there were three charges from the Bentley on my credit card that did not belong there. Three days and two phone calls later, two of the carges have been removed, but a new charge, has been added. None of these charges add up to the one item I charged--the $21.00 breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly nice, but I was double charged”
Reviews.Author: shatstick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise for the price. We were 'upgraded' to a junior suite which was more of a handicap room. Lots of windows, nice bed. Mostly clean and nice. I've given this hotel a 2 (Poor) for one significant reason. I reserved AND paid in full for my room on Travelocity a week in advance. When I checked out, the person at the front desk said it was already paid for and that we were good to leave. Two days later, I was charged by the hotel on my credit card that they said would only be charged for 'incidentals'. This is hotel management 101. Don't charge a credit card when the room is already paid for. I called and spoke to two front desk people. The second understood the mistake on their part. The first did not so I needed to speak to someone better trained. The charge was reversed, or at least I'll see in 2-3 business days. But this is the kind of headache a customer does not need after a visit to New York. Also the hotel's charge was $40 less than the Travelocity price. So ask for the better price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but its ten blocks to....... anything”
Reviews.Author: williambonnie76
Reviews.Content: This is a cool hotel. The rooms are an ok size, and they are decorated nicely, the staff is very friendly, and it seems hip; in fact everyone seemed to be younger than 30, not a problem. The problem was that its 10 blocks to anything...anything. Ten blocks is a strange distance in that ...its too short to get a cab, and yet, if you keep walking it ?...its tiring. The subway is ten blocks, a restaurant is ten blocks, the park is ten blocks. Its a great hotel, but its no where. Some people have said its near some hospitals , and for something nearby like that it would be great, for a nice trip to NYC attractions ??....its ten blocks too far.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ok”
Reviews.Author: Katarina2311
Reviews.Content: We liked our room on the 9th floor, which had a great view, was spacious and clean. Attention in the hotel was also good and very friendly. It is slightly remote, about 10 to 15 minutes walk to the closest metro station, and about 20 minutes to Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in "quiet" area”
Reviews.Author: EsterGC
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Manhatten and we stayed 8 nights in a "deluxe room" with 2 queen beds on 6th floor - no upgrades at all. Yes, you can hear the Queensboro Bridge traffic. Yes, there is a lot of traffic on York Ave. Yes, it is located 0.6 miles from the closest subway. The minibar contains no liquids at all, only nuts/snacks. No coffee maker or bottled water in the room (we are not used to the chlorine taste of tap water). And no treadmill in the small fitness room. But we LOVE the sound of the busy Brooklyn Bridge, watching the traffic in the streets, walking around the streets of Manhattan, riding bicycles on 5th Avenue and in Central Park, watching the breath taking night view from the hotel's top floor restaurant and chatting with the friendly staff. The Ritz Diner closeby (recommended by the hotel) is open 24/7 and worth every penny. The French Bistro 62 (also recommended by the hotel) has all-you-can-eat mussels every Tuesday, fabulous together with a glass of their Chardonnay. Oh yes, and for a great food experience, visit Asia de Cuba at the Morgan Hotel. Wonderful food to share and great cocktails. We will definitely stay here again, away from the buzz of Times Square and Broadway, but still close enough to everything, you never feel bored.

Reviews.Title: “Noise levels and service are not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: kataroni
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a standard (queen-bed) room and after checking in found out that the manager had "upgraded" us to a room with two double beds. We complained about how the smaller beds were not an "upgrade", so the staff attempted to switch us to a second-floor room with a king bed, but it was WAY too loud (we could hear shouted conversations between pedestrians outside) and the air conditioner sounded like a freight train. The second night we were moved to a suite, which was nicer, except for the fact that the toilet ran VERY loudly for at least 10 minutes each time you flushed. Also, elevator is SLOW!! This place is pricey, and in my opinion, NOT worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon022
Reviews.Content: Very poor service in the hotel. We were charged unfairly mini bar expenses, key cards stopped working in the middle of our stay, personnel was constantly in and out of the room (housekeepers, more towels, chocolates, all done separately and by different personnel) and the hotel bar was ridiculously expensive. The mini bar charges were the weirdest thing, it seems like either the personnel in the hotel was snacking from our mini bar, or the the charges were made by the previous tenant, but either way, we never got a receipt (like we should have) and were notified of the charges only when checking out. The room was big and beds very comfortable, but the traffic noise was awful, and made sleeping difficult. Next time I visit New York I'll chooose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of customer service!”
Reviews.Author: jjogden
Reviews.Content: Upon check in A/C was not working, was fixed quickly. The mini bar was unplugged with a note saying do not plug in so therefore all drinks were hot. After spending all day in the city when we came back the lights and tv did not work. Called front desk, sent maintenance up. He messed with the switch then left, still not fixed. We had to wedge a piece of cardboard behind the key switch to keep lights and tv on. We called front desk to switch rooms they said they had no availabilty but did not offer any type of discount on room. Also parking garage was closed due to construction. We had to park a block away in another parking garage which was more expensive. The food at the hotel restraunt was terrible. We ordered mozzerrella sticks which were cold and were just heated in the microwave. Being that we paid extra for the view you think the windows would have been cleaned. The customer service is terrible, I have had better service at a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISSAPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: Angel2259
Reviews.Content: Does any one know how to get in touch with bentley hotel? I stayed there for my 21st birthday for 4 nights all payed for BEFORE! At check out we had two things out the mini bar which probably added up to Â£18 and got a receipt for that, now a few days later, i still have a waiting transaction of Â£70 coming out of my bank?????? from BENTLEY hotel we dint damage anything kept the room tidy and made sure all are rubbish was in bags before we left!!!!!I dont think its very fair to keep taking my money out my bank!!! when we first got there the heating dint work and leaked but we wernt to fussed as we had so much to do in new york!!! i would not recomened going to this hotel and theres no shop next to the hotel its a building site with loads of banging!!!!!!! Ahhhhh

Reviews.Title: “You donâ€™t want to stay there.”
Reviews.Author: florisimo1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights, from 2 to 9 May â€™11. The first problem we encountered, on arrival, was that at 15:00 hours, check in time, the room was not ready and we had to wait for an additional hour and a half in the lobby. Then we found out that the internet services in our floor were not available. We complained and were moved to another floor where this service worked well. Additional problems we encountered were: cold and unclean rooms and bathrooms and bath mats not always available. The excuse was that the air conditioning was on in the whole hotel and, since there were no individual thermostats, there was nothing that could be done to warm up our room. One evening we could not enter the room because both keys were not working. Finally, never did the three elevators work simultaneously, one was always inactive or being used by the staff for towel delivery to the guest floors or food delivery to the restaurant. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: kapond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Bentley April 29-May 2, 2011. We chose the Bentley because we stayed there 3 years ago and remembered it being very nice. My sister booked online and paid in full when she booked. She called the day before we left to confirm that we would be in late and we had booked a room with 2 beds. We got in at 8:00 pm and were told there were no rooms with double beds. They were going to upgrade us to a suite with a king bed. We asked if there was a couch to sleep on because we had 3 people. They said that they would get housekeeoing to bring up extra sheets and blankets. (That never happened) Even though it was very obvious that someone was sleeping on the couch the maids never left any extra sheets or blankets. In the morning the light in our bathroom burned out. We had to bring a lamp from the other room in there to be able to see. They sent someone up to change the light bulb right away. The door in the bathroom did not shut. The maids never left the enough towels. We started with 3 bath towels, 2 hand towels and a bath mat. The next day we had 2 bath towels and that is it. We called for more towels and the brought us 2 bath towels. The next day we got 1 bath towel and 1 hand towel and no bath mat. This happened every day and we had to call for more towels. This should not happen in an upsacle motel. It was quite annoying. They are supposed to have coffee in the lobby all day. There were several times whem there was no coffee. One day when we standing there getting some coffee a huge cockroach ran across the floor. The door man walked over a stepped on it! The doormen did not go out and get taxi's for you. It was very difficult to get taxi's on this street. They often acted like it was a chore to open the door for you! Our mini bar was broken. All of the water, beer and pop were warm. We took a bottle of water out of it and it was opened and someone had drank out of it! Gross! I think that the housekeeping was terrible. Many of the things that were wrong were the fault of housekeeping. We would never stay here again. We have stayed at different hotels that cost the same as the Bentley and we would go back to those.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of caring in staff made our stay stressful”
Reviews.Author: Deni22
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a trip to NY for pleasure. We chose the Bentley for our hotel. When we arrived the front desk had no idea that we had requested a smoking room. This is very important to my sister because there are few places left where one can enjoy a cigarette. They were not able to honor our request and seemed nonchalant about it. My sister told them that was why we chose this hotel, and were told that we could get one for the next two nights, if we were willing to move. We decided to go with this. We did request a high room with a view and were given one on the 10th of 21 floors with no river view. The hotel was not full!!! We were tired and in a hurry to go to our dinner reservation, so we let it ride. The room we had was poorly maintained and looked tired and worn. The next morning, we called to get our smoking room, and were told that there was not one available, the man at the desk had not put a hold for the room for us and it was no longer available. Again there was no apology or effort to make us happy. We decided to go to the lobby and make a fuss. We asked to see the manager, and he came over with an attitude. He immediately said that no requests were guaranteed. My sister loudly informed him that the smoking room was the reason we had chosen this hotel and I voiced our other complaints. Only after our having to be unpleasant, did the manager finally say that he would try to get us a smoking room for that night. We left for the day, and came back to find that we had indeed been given a smoking room.( How did one suddenly become available?) However there were no washclothes and only one hand towel, and no soap. We had to call several times and wait more than an hour to get this corrected. Our request for ice was never honored. As a result, our trip was not as enjoyable as it could have been. I have stayed at many New York hotels, and this is by far my worst experience.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate rooms, but location not close to attractions.”
Reviews.Author: KibbyBulldog88
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel so I'll keep my complaints to a minimum. The good: paid only $180/night for a 3* Manhattan hotel. Rooms are ok size for NYC, clean & modernly furnished rooms, comfortable bed. The bad: located right next to the FDR highway entrance - non stop cars honking throughout the day (I can hear everything even from the 10th floor). Not really walking distance to the museums, Time Sq. etc...we had to take a cab everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, The worst staff in the world!!”
Reviews.Author: alex0608
Reviews.Content: Well, like all hotels this one has its good points and itâ€™s bad. The good points are that it is an inexpensive (price per night) room with frequent free room upgrades (we were put in a king room which although hardly huge was nice and suited us just fine) and in a great location! Nice and Quiet Street with good views from the restaurant. However we were let down by a few things. The first is the staff, I have never encountered staff who cared so little about their customers. The doormen never spoke, the receptionists didnâ€™t have time for you and the manager was never to be seen. Whenever we asked for directions or information we were always greeted by looks of contempt. All of this I could have lived with without a problem (after all in NY all you really need is a bed for the night) however on the 3rd morning we discovered thick green mould beneath the bath mat. I immediately went down to complain and was greeted by a receptionist who clearly didnâ€™t care, gave no apology or explanation and just said someone should be able to deal with it that day. I couldnâ€™t believe how bad this service was but like many places I found in NY, unless there is a tip in the offing customer service just doesnâ€™t exist. The other bad point is the restaurant, extremely over priced buffet ($17.95 pp plus tax) for some fruit, toast and a tiny hot food section and donâ€™t even consider the evening meal! HOWEVER I must say again that for a nice, clean (except the one example) affordable hotel in central NY the Bentley was all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Operation”
Reviews.Author: travel0pini0n
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to NYC every year for shows, shopping and relaxation. We chose to stay at a different hotel every year. We have stayed at some of the finest hotels in the city. WE have now found a home at The Bentley. The rate, the service, and the room were all exceptional. We enjoyed the slower pace of the Upper East Side as compared to the hectic Times Sauare area. The travel around the city from The Benley was no big deal. The staff from the doorman, reception, restaurant and bar were friendly and helpful. We booked directly with the Hotel and were offered an upgrade. I have not met the manager, Helena Blat, but cudos to you for a classy operation.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: holidays_4_life
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister went to new york this april, This hotel was lovely, i dont understand why there are bad comments on here, the reception staff were really nice and very helpful, they even ordered us a pizza on our first night as we arrived late, we got upgraded to a suite to, we were very happy about that as we were not expecting it, we had 2 TV's a huge bed that was very comfortable, a nice size bathroom and a street view. We walked everywere from this hotel, times square was only a 20-25 min walk but we walked fast, its only about a 10-15 min walk to central park, not many blocks from bloomingdales:) and museums were close by too. so if you dont mind walking its really not that far, we found our way round new york really easily we were there to see new york not to just stay in the room. i would definatly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: CW29
Reviews.Content: Not my favorite hotel. The parking is listed at $24/night but that garage is under construction so they sent me down the block for $40/night (turns out there is another $24 a block away!). When I asked for compensation, and yes I had to ask not once but twice, they offered me a free breakfast. For $17pp you get inedible eggs and soggy fruit. The beds are very comfortable but rooms are small. The bathroom faucet was missing parts and the grout needs replacement, making the bathroom look really shabby. Our door stuck so you had to slam it to close it. Service at the desk was surly. I will not be going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous :o)”
Reviews.Author: Angel1471
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week for my birthday. We had an amazing suite with fabulous views on the 18th floor. Helena and her staff made us feel so welcome and special. Thank you so much. The hotel is well placed away from the madness of midtown Manhattan, but a brief walk takes you to the subway next to Bloomingdales and 5 mins later you are at Times Square, Herald Square etc etc. Complimentary tea & coffee is available in the lobby 24 hours a day, and ice is brought up to you on request. The restaurant has lovely views, we enjoyed breakfast there in the mornings. Its also reasonably priced for dinner and has a completely different ambiance in the evenings. We would highly recommend the Bentley :o) A big thank you from Angelique & Dominc

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Bentley Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveCabo55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bentley Hotel for eight nights. We had reserved the standard room and were happy to receive an upgrade to a king room. The room was comfortable, and the bathroom was fine. The water was hot and they supplied very nice toiletries. The bed was very comfortable. The TV was an LCD flat screen, with a lot of cable channels. The only complaint we had was with the air conditioning. When we arrived the A/C unit was set to heat. We like the room very cool. We asked if it could be set to cool, so they sent maintenance immediately and they made an adjustment to the unit but it still did not cool the room adequately . We asked for a fan and they brought one to the room, and that helped. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We enjoyed the complimentary coffee and tea available in the restaurant in the morning, and in the lobby the rest of the day. There are many restaurants nearby and a very large grocery store under the 59th Street Bridge on 1st Ave. Since we stayed for a week, we purchased a 7 day bus/subway pass for $29 per person. It was a great way to get around Manhattan. We enjoyed our stay at the Bentley and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great and affordable little hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: fadryn
Reviews.Content: The thing that really stood out for me during my stay at the Bentley was the staff. They are absolutely fantastic. Polite, friendly and could not do enough to make your stay comfortable and pleasant. They have some real gems there, and they really made my stay special. The hotel itself is pretty good for the price in NYC. The exterior looks a little tired, but stepping through the doors the interior could be a completely different hotel. Welcoming, clean and contemporary fittings are throughout the hotels. The rooms are a good size for NYC with fantastic views of the city. Wi-fi is throughout the hotel and for $10 a day you can get online, which is pretty good for a city hotel. The location isn't bad with lots of really lovely neighbourhood restaurants and shops nearby, and Bloomingdales about 10 minutes walk away, so it's ideal for shopping. The only down sides for me with this hotel was that the nearest subway is also about 10 minutes walk away. Now, I spend a lot of my time hiking and so having a wander along to the subway didn't really bother me at all, but at the end of a hard day in the city those last few blocks from the subway seemed a long way, so if you are feeling lazy jump into one of the abundant cabs. My other very minor gripe was the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the bedroom. I'm not very good in the morning until I've had my first shot of coffee so having that immediate caffine as soon as I open my eyes is considered a must for me. However, there is a very nice Starbucks just around the corner, and whilst not my first choice for coffee, it was very handy for the essential morning coffee. Also, for those that don't want to pay $10 to get on the wi-fi in the hotel, you can use the wi-fi for free in the local Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Not in the heart of things... but well worth a look”
Reviews.Author: GromitNorwich
Reviews.Content: We have just returned (literally!!) from a five night sight seeing break in New York, and stayed at this hotel. It is true that the Bentley is just off the main tourist area, but we found this to be ok as we don't mind walking, and you often find other interesting shops, places etc when out of the main tourist trail. The subway was very easily accesible and we used it often, we ate breakfast at the diner on the next block which was good value for money and all part of the experience of New York. We ate in the rooftop restaurant one night during our stay, the food was fine and the service was good, but the view of the 59th street bridge from there was spectacular!! Overall the hotel was very clean, and the rooms were fine, this was a nice surprise as hotel rooms in New York are always reported as being small. Housekeeping was very good, and all staff were very helpful. Feedback from others mentioned the lifts were slow ???? We liked this hotel and would come back again .

Reviews.Title: “Poor Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: wellington251
Reviews.Content: I would like to warn anyone planning on staying at this hotel for more than one night that you will not be provided with any towels on the second night. In the morning after our first night we left for sightseeing, when we returned around 5 to shower and prepare for dinner we noticed there was not one towel or washcloth in the bathroom. We called the desk to request towels and they said they would send some up. After one hour and three phone calls we finally received two towels and one wash cloth. Very disappointing. Also if you are expecting a top sheet on the bed you will be dissappointed. You will have to sleep under a bedspread that has probably never been washed. I agree with other reviews that the front desk does not care about anyone staying at the hotel. The elevators are very slow too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel @ A Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: FelixG059
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at The Bentley Hotel in early March 2011. The only reason why we considered staying here was because it was cheaper than all the other hotels. We booked our room through Bookit.com. We paid about $129.00 a night for a 10 day stay (awesome rate right?) When we first arrived from the airport it was located directly next to a Vet Hospital and the entrance to the FDR highway. The area looked a little sketchy at first but not horrible. There's construction work going on so there's alot of cones everywhere and signs blah blah blah. We walked up to the front desk and the employee, a hispanic fellow said hello and started to check us in. He seemed nice but not personable at all. Now maybe it's because I work in customer service, but If I'm the first person the client meets at the hotel: I'm going to make sure I have a smile and I go above and beyond for my customer. Well lets move on, people on other reviews complained about the elevators being slow. I found that they are just fine; all elevators take a while. It's no different than any other hotel elevators I've been in. Let;s talk the room. The room was a good size, especially for New York. I did think it was weird that the shower has half a glass door as a splash guard; but it seemed to work effectively. Housekeeping...GREAT! They were awesome! They did everything I requested and always left extra towels. I had one incident where my room key didn't work..front desk was nice, again no smile or a " how are you enjoying your stay" ehh...oh well. The hotel has a bar or restaurant on the roof top. Prices seem fair for NY and the views up there are pretty great. Finally...the neighborhood...walk up a few blocks and you are literally in the heart of everything. Right next to Central Park and shops and CHASE BANK at almost every corner. I rate this hotel a 4 but would have given them a 5 if the service from the front desk to the door people would have been nicer. This hotel has everything it takes to be a top luxury hotel, except they really need a staff that knows what the Service Industry is all about. Other than that..they're great and I recommend this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveler19822021
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, which is saying a lot considering I have stayed at a $30/night Motel 6. The reservation was booked using a third-party website for an average of $220 per night for 3 nights. Since there were three of us, I specifically asked for a king room with a rollaway. I was put on hold while the agent checked with the hotel, and the reservation for a king with a rollaway was confirmed. I received a confirmation from the hotel indicating we had a king room for 3 guests. The confirmation was from the Bentley Hotel (including a letter from Helena Blat). When we arrived, I asked to confirm that we were in a king before we went to our room. For the first time, I was told that we were in a double-room and that rollaways were not allowed in king rooms due to fire code. This would have been nice to know beforehand. How did they think 3 people were going to share a king room without a rollaway? Of course there were no king suites available, so we were stuck with the double room. The front desk attendants were less than helpful. Unfortunately, this was only the beginning of the disaster that is the Bentley Hotel. The air conditioner was not working in our room, the bathtub/shower would not drain water unless you physically held down the lever, and there were no handtowels or washclothes. The next morning when we left for the day, we asked for them to fix the air conditioning, bathtub lever and bring us sheets since the "premium bedding" included only a comforter, which was way too hot for a room without a working air conditioner. For some reason they could not understand our request for sheets, so we had to explain what a sheet was and why we wanted it. When we arrived back to our hotel that evening, the air conditioning and bathtub had not even been looked at. We called again and they said they would send someone up to work on it. When we got back from dinner, neither problem was fixed, but we were left with a mess of dirt and debris in the bathtub (which was very hard to wash since the drain was not working!!). At this point, my brother went down and requested a new room. The new room was smaller, but the air conditioner and shower worked. The dresser was tilted forward and the drawers would slide open, blocking the path in front of the beds. We had to use magazines to prop the dresser up so that the drawers would close. This is such a simple thing to fix so I don't understand at all why it would be this way. This time we had washclothes, but apparently in order to get washclothes you have to sacrifice your bath mat, which is absolutely necessary due to the ridiculous shower design. They should spend more money on repairs rather than trying to make the hotel look trendy. The rooftop restaurant was closed for most of our stay (what a shock!), but on the last day it had reopened and we went up for breakfast. The food was horrible and tasted like it had been sitting out for awhile. The Ritz Dinner is great for breakfast and is only 2 blocks away. We got great food there for much less than we paid for nasty food at the hotel. Never once during our entire stay did the staff at the front desk greet us when we returned to the hotel. Out of the dozen or so times we went through the front doors, only twice did a doorman opened it for us. The elevators were extremely slow. One time after waiting for over 5 minutes, an elevator came down with a worker, only for a worker to tell us no one could come on because he was going back up. If you dare stay at this hotel, I suggest getting the highest floor possible, because by the time the elevator would get to the 14th floor they were full. We had to take the stairs (14 floors) twice because of the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: GinaBe58
Reviews.Content: Considering that it's located in one of the priciest zip codes in the world, the price is a steal. Rooms are very clean. I don't think they offer breakfast. Hey, you're in Manhattan; there's always a deli around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in New York”
Reviews.Author: DanM5
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in New York, the staff were very polite and helpful.. Although the hotel was a distance away from the main sites, the tube was only a few blocks away. Great location for shopping at Bloomingdales. On arrival had a complimentary upgrade, views were amazing overlooking the Queensboro bridge towards Roosevelt Island. The location of the hotel did not bother me at all, i don't have a problem with walking about. Would definately come back in the future

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, out-of-the-way hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldCitizenHDF
Reviews.Content: the hotel is beautiful, good price. the ONLY problem with this hotel, it's on 1st Ave., the nearest subway is on 3rd Ave. so you walk at least 10-15 min to get there. that gets old very fast. otherwise a great in all aspects. clean rooms, comfy beds, very stylish overall.

Reviews.Title: “what the time of your life?”
Reviews.Author: wclarkeuk
Reviews.Content: First time going to new york so did not have a clue where to stay or anything about the layout. we got to the hotel and they was so friendly and helpfull, we got there earlier so the gave us a room that was already avalible. our room was beautifull they are so nice the beds are big and cosy and the night's sleep is amazing. the staff were all very knowledgeable about the local area and would even order you a pizza if you needed one. i would say the hotel resturant was not very good but the location of the hotel is so good its on york avenue and is a short walk from lexington were bloomindales is. the hotel overall was excelent i will say though that they take $25 of you per night of staying for deposit and they give you this back except that i have not yet recived mine and i am still waiting . i would recommend this hotel to anyone im only 18 and was worried about the hotel and it would be in the middle of now where but seriously i would tell everyone to go there . by the way do not use the mini bar it's pricey :)

Reviews.Title: “O.K but staff could do so much more.....”
Reviews.Author: mary1949
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the greatest of positions but pricewise O.K...found the staff very lazy nobody really wanted to help.....even the doorman tried to rip us off....SAD!!! ' If this is how the hotel wants to be represented then l suppose the doorman was doing a good job........... the room was in great shape, very clean, but the doorman again hadent even opened a door for one guest whilst we were being checked in....the checkin staff were just so apathetic....the location isn't great but if you dont mind a bit of a walk there are some great food spots 3 or 4 blocks away..the hotel is located down by the river on 62nd street. there's a great walk near by and a cable car over to rosevelt island just a few blocks away.....dont use their business centre as it computors are not really very good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific 8 night stay at The Bentley”
Reviews.Author: neilnco
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 nights at The Bentley. Our room was nice and clean and the hotel staff was very nice. Bellmen would open the door almost every time we came and went from the hotel; other staff would ring the elevator button for us when they saw us approaching. A really nice touch. Some of the reviews about the location on TripAdvisor are a bit dated. The gas station beside the hotel is completely gone now. There were a lot of very nice restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel. My wife and I really enjoyed our walks from the hotel to Central Park and either uptown to the museums or downtown to the theater district. I would recommend the hotel to people in good health who enjoy urban walking; not so much for people with mobility issues. There is good quality coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The staff would have liked it better if they had had no guests to serve....”
Reviews.Author: Lilly9_28
Reviews.Content: Travelled from Ontario with my teenagers for their March Break (stayed an entire week). Front desk staff was very unwelcoming, unsmiling: We were not welcomed at all, nor bid a good day, on any of the 7 days we were there; they did not look up from whatever they were doing. At day 5 we made it up to our room on the 19th floor after a long day out in the city, only to find our keys did not work. I went back downstairs to learn that the keys must be re-coded at day 5 because there is no way to validate them for 7 days. ??? I then verified that if I had recieved a notice from the night before, or the morning of, I would have been able to visit the front desk, had my keys validated, and avoided the incovenience of what had occurred. I am still waiting for an apology for the inconvenience.... Had to call for an extra washcloth on 4 of the 7 days we were there. 3 of us were registered but only 2 washcloths were left. When I asked why only 2 were left when 3 washcloths were used, along with 3 towels, and it was obvious 3 of us were in the room, I was told that according to hotel regulations only 2 washcloths needed to be left (and 3 towels). I told the staff person that we were not about to share washcloths. I wonder if that means that if 4 of us had been in the room we would have had to repeatedly request an extra towel, as well as 2 washcloths....The bathroom was designed to have only one permanent, fixed door on the shower so the result was the floor was wet after the first person used the shower. Re-using our towels was not an option because they were needed to dry the floor after each person finished in the shower. We received a notice that the hot water was going to be turned off on one of the nights (from 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM the following morning). That didn't seem too unreasonable except for the fact that there was no hot water the following morning as had been promised. Thank goodness we had showered the night before. We would have liked to have showered that morning but had to resort to washing up in extremely cold water instead. I am a runner and had to change my workout schedule and not run that morning because I would have had no warm water to shower with. We were there for St. Patrick's Day. I asked for information on the parade. I was given the correct time and location for the start but wrong information for the direction of the parade route. The parade moved uptown and I was told my the front desk staff that it went downtown. That was a gross error and we could have avoided the inconvenience and craziness of hopping the train on that day to get downtown and could have simply walked over to the parade route from our hotel if I had received the correct information. I am a single parent who was willing to spend the money to stay at a hotel right in Manhatten so my children could have a full NYC experience - for an entire week. I did not get the service I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous! Never Again..........”
Reviews.Author: blueangel18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 9 years ago which I must say found absolutely nothing to complain about at all, the staff, hospitality, rooms etc were all very good....... 9 years on I can't say that I found it at all appealing from when we first arrived we felt that we had arrived at an inconvienient time due to discourtesy of the staff on duty in reception..... from then on it just went from bad to worse ...... constantly woken throughout the night until all hours with shouting, banging of doors, very loud music/TV we contacted reception who assured us that this would be rectifed but nothing ever happened the noise just continued to go on and that happened for the 5 nights that we stayed there....... We also had a note pushed through our door to inform us that the water would be off for approximately 8 hours 10pm-6am due to some emergency repair....... next morning arrived NO HOT WATER!..... when we contacted reception we were duely informed that this would be back on in 30 mins...... 30 mins been and gone still no hot water this carried on with numerous frustrating telephone calls to which the staff were just so "matter of fact" about the situation they obviously expected their residents just to wash in COLD water and forget about showering..... just the right thing to set you up for a long day out sighseeing!....... On our third day we had a leak from the room upstairs when we called concierge to check this out they sent a handyman who had taken a look at it... he then went upstairs to check the room directly above us returned some 15 mins later said that it would be ok and that the resident upstairs had left the bath running!..... to this day nothing was ever done about our room and anyone staying there will see for themselves room 1202!..... Anyway I hope this helps if anyone is wishing to stay there my advice..... DON'T..... It was once a lovely hotel but now its just the PITS!....... Think they must have changed management now....... Just wish it had been like it was 9 years ago......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality, affordable price!”
Reviews.Author: Howlindawgs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bentley Hotel in January 2011 when my dog needed surgery at Animal Medical Center. I wasn't going to stay overnight but his procedure got bumped so I needed a room in a pinch. The front desk clerk was helpful, kind, and polite to a Vermonter in the big city. The room was classy, clean, and very comfortable. The hotel is right next to the animal hospital and he could even have stayed with me if he hadn't been admitted overnight. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone from out of town who has a pet at Animal Medical Center, or who is just looking for a nice place to stay on the East Side.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend”
Reviews.Author: irispike
Reviews.Content: Every day had new surprises.Clock radio not working,did not get requested wake up call. Desk in room so large could not reach closure for blinds without climbing on top of desk! Clothes wet from rain put back in my suitcase!!!! No hot water last night of stay, waited 1 1/2 hour after calling no one came(desk said a "few minutes"). Surley and weird desk clerk. No receipt or anything on checkout.I could go on.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels for your money”
Reviews.Author: oNthEgO3037
Reviews.Content: Although the rates are appealing our stay was filled with disappointments. We stayed for one night and found that the hotel staff is friendly enough, but removed from the typical hospitable feeling normally expected at any average hotel. They do the bare minimum. The decor and rooms are not as nice as expected. When we arrived in our room it was very clean, but controlling the heat was miserable. We gave up on trying to cool the room and even without the heat on, it was too hot! There is no vent in the bathroom so that adds to the lack of ventilation and heat situation. The 3 elevators in the hotel were always very slow and sometimes not working. The elevators were almost always packed with frustrated hotel guests complaining about how long they had to wait just to get to the lobby. We spent 30 minutes in elevators by the time we went to the rooftop restaurant just to get coffee and tea and then get to the lobby to leave for the day! Ridiculous!! The hotel is a bit of a distance from the main streets and happening places. This is to be expected if you look at the location on a map. Although, if you are not street savvy or have any hangups about walking at night on an empty street off the beatin path I would not stay here. We always felt comfortable and walked everywhere, but we are used to it. If you are in NYC for a short time it is not the place to stay because you will waste too much time finding how to get somewhere and actually getting there.

Reviews.Title: “Let them change your mind.”
Reviews.Author: b_green25
Reviews.Content: This NYC trip was very last minute for my partner and I so we booked through a third party website. Unfortunately, they failed to accurately describe the Bentley which led to disappointment and frustration. If there is one thing I have learned while on this trip is that communication is KEY. If you have a problem speak up. My partner and I ran into a few obstacles on our first day but by our second day they "changed our minds." I had contacted the hotel manager, Helena directly through email and expressed my concerns; giving her the opportunity to show me what a four star hotel should be. She was very professional I greatly appreciated her willingness to fix our many issues. Overall the hotel has a great view of the 59th street bridge, NYC, and the river. The beds are comfy. The rooms tend to be hot.. so be prepared for the air not to work. The cleaners are very good & nice. The breakfast was not my favorite but the dinner was right up my alley. No free wi-fi, and no fridge. Starbucks is very close (as usual = free wi-fi). I think the only reason I expected a fridge was because they do not offer ice with or without a bucket. I like cold drinks which is understandable... right? By the end of the trip I was/am stratified. My recommendation for the Bentley is to work on their convenience as a "four star hotel." There is no need for the constant nickel & diming.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, noisy room - awful”
Reviews.Author: UsuallyEasyTPlease
Reviews.Content: I paid $40 extra for an upgrade to a "Deluxe, Oversize Room with a Wall of Windows" - what I got was the smallest hotel room I've ever seen, just enough room to squeeze around the bed, and a small window (which did show a slice of the river). The walls are so thin that "car noise" is constant. Had to call the front desk for hot water in the tub. The desk clerk supervisor made me speak with her and wait 45 minutes after I rejected the room as totally not as described, and then lied to me, telling me there would be a discount, while telling bookit.com they'd switched me to a better room, which they refused to do. Never going back. Only stay here if you like freezing water and tiny noisy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved hotel - enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: sunnyflies
Reviews.Content: I stayed here five years ago and found it has smoothed out its bumps. Check in was easy, the elevators have brighter lighting, the hallways too. No more groping along in the dark - hip as both looked back then. Our immaculate bedroom on the 17th floor was very stylishly furnished in a contemporary manner, as is the rest of the hotel. The king sized bed was very comfortable and was made up european style with a puffy duvet instead of a top sheet and blankets. The room had a great city view with a sizable glimpse of the East River. At night it was magical. The Bentley is located within walking distance of the subway, lots of busses, Bloomingdales and several major hospitals. Its bathrooms are not large, but they are clean and modern. Ask for a higher floor if city noises might keep you awake, because the East River Drive and the Avenue can be noisy. The hotel has an arrangement with a garage nearby which charges $24 for guests of the hotel - very reasonable for New York. I think the hotel is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Bentley, great value, spotless”
Reviews.Author: westford
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel. Most of the guests seemed to be European. The rooms are fantastic, the views great. I love waking up and watching the cars on the Queensborrow bridge right at eye leve. Then the cable car goes by....don't change clothes in front of the window...:) Great value, great service...wonderful breakfast and an overall great value. Uptown 5 blocks from "the park".

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, bring your own ice bucket!”
Reviews.Author: FrancesFC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not far off of Lexington and 3rd, where the closest subway is, it is right near the river as well. It is a decent value for the money although a bit out of the way of the theatre district etc. The rooms are average size, decent sized bathroom, bed is very comfortable and there is minimal television channels. The rooftop patio is okay, I guess it may be much nicer in the summer when you can go out on the patio, but in the winter, let's just say skip it and go else where if you really want a great view. The breakfast buffet is a complete joke though, I mean 17.95 for eggs, bacon and breads??? Some must pay it, so I guess they keep doing it. We did not partake in that, so can't comment on how good it really was, but just an observation on the overpriced selection. Day staff where very helpful, the night staff are not the sharpest knives in the drawer! Two rather funny things happened though: 1) I asked where the ice machine was and they say they have to bring it to your room, they weren't kidding a guy brought a bag of ice to my room, no container for it, just a bag-of-ice. Very funny.. we stuck it in the sink. 2) No plug for the bath, they have to bring you up a cover for the bath which took about half an hour, so it is a bit silly. Good to do if you are on a budget, it's very clean and we felt quite safe here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Excellent View, and Customer Service 2nd to none”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMM100
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that I have been to NY City many times for work and leisure, so I knew the lay of the land and have experienced a spectrum of hotel amenities along the way. When selecting a hotel for my fiancÃ©es 29th Birthday (it was her first time in NY City), I prioritized what I thought would be important; panoramic views, location to transit, elegant accommodations, and of course a reasonable room rate were my top 4 must-have's. I read multiple review's on the Bentley Hotel, on this site and others, and booked a room for 3 nights. While reading the review's, I noticed that an attentive hotel manager was answering customer complaints and also (more often than not), thanking customers for their positive feedback. So, I decided to contact Helena Blat to ensure that our stay would be a success. Without going into the specifics of what Helena did for us (some things should remain confidential), I have to say that I was more than appreciative for what she offered. For one, her follow up with me was one of the best customer service experiences that I have experienced in the hotel industry. It's as if they trained her at the Ritz Carleton where the motto is "ladies and gentlemen serving ladies and gentlemen". The extra touches that Helena was willing to add to our trip made our stay a classy and memorable one. The room was clean and spacious (particularly by NY standards), the view remarkable (by my standards) and the elevator was efficient. The front desk staff was professional and courteous, and the check-in/check out process was quick and simple. Even the valet staff was professional and friendly. If you are looking for one of the best value view's in NY City, look no further. As long as you are above the 15th floor and in a corner room, you will be impressed. The transit system is a bit of a walk, but not to the extent that some people have made it out to be. Even in February (it was 25 degrees and we came from Florida), it was not an unreasonable distance for us to walk. The neighborhood is upscale residential so you are able to admire the brownstone architecture and some interesting restaurants/stores on the way to the NQR train which goes downtown. Besides, after a long day of visiting the bustling neighborhoods in Manhattan, you will enjoy coming home to a relatively quiet residential area. There are literally hundreds of hotels in Manhattan to choose from and many of them are at a similar price point. So to some extent, you take a chance when selecting a room. I will say that your experience is more in your control than you think, so make an effort to research the property and communicate with the front desk/management; you might be as pleased with your experience as I was if you take my advice. One more thing, if Helena Blat ever goes to work for another hotel, I hope she communicates that to me so that I can stay wherever she is managing. Customer service in many ways is a relic of the past, Helena showed my fiancÃ©e and I that at the Bentley hotel (under her stewardship) it is alive and well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and upscale, but they don't pay attention to details”
Reviews.Author: jrzee
Reviews.Content: The Bentley is a nicely designed hotel with very convenient highway access and a spectacular view from their hotel Diner. But they are not attentive to the small things that would make this a quality stay. In my room, the shade could not close all the way. There is no coffee available in the morning - not in my room nor in the lobby. They did not put a clean cup in the bathroom each day - leaving the dirty one on the sink each day. The sink was clogged. And there was no way to adjust the room temperature - the heater was broken. And they charged me a different price for the same drink on different nights. (sigh). But such a beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “The Bentley is an Upper East Side gem that shines!”
Reviews.Author: campjung
Reviews.Content: Our son recently moved to NYC and lives on the Upper East side near 64th and 2nd Ave. We planned on visiting him over a long weekend and wanted to stay within walking distance on his apartment. I discovered the Bentley Hotel (located at 500 East 62nd) and was excited that it was only an eight minute walk to his place. We were looking forward to staying at the hotel and had positive expectations after viewing photos posted at the property's website. Our expectations were exceeded and then some! We were greeted by a very pleasant desk clerk and given our keys. I was impressed that the keys were blank suggesting anonymity if they fell into someone else's hands. We rode the elevator to the 15th floor and entered our room and were astonished at how big it was and the unique decor. The view to the west of NYC was fabulous and clearly impressive to us. On to the important amenities...the bathroom was spacious and the towels were thick, soft and thirsty. We love a shower with power and this was great. The bath had all the usual lotions and soaps. The body wash was a nice unexpected touch. I like coffee first thing in the morning and I missed a coffee maker in the room. This proved not t be a problem as I am generally awake and about long before my wife. I knew that coffee was available on the 21st floor at the rooftop restaurant. Even if you don't drink coffee or plan on eating somewhere else, the elevator ride up is worth it. What a view! It really was breathtaking. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet one morning. It was luxurious to spend a leisurely time eating and scanning the skyline. What really is most important in a hotel room is how well one rests. My wife and I had some of the best night's sleep in a while. the bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows generous and so soft. We did linger in bed longer than we anticipated. The Bentley Hotel is a great choice for a NYC visit. We would highly recommend it for your stay whether you are a seasoned traveler (we aren't) or a first time visitor. You be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Barbyjo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at the Bently, October 2010 & Oct 2009. We loved the location, the service and the room. Yes breakfast is OTT, but you can fill yourself with coffee until you're ready to go to the diner (my partener) or the nearby sushi bar( me) The staff are really great (Hi Tony!) and can't do enough for you. The area is quiet and safe with everything close at hand, without the "brassiness" of other areas of the city. See you in October Bentley!

Reviews.Title: “Managerial Staff don't care!”
Reviews.Author: Denleparain
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our 1 year wedding anniversary. The aircon is really noisy, the walls are not sound proof. On the day we checked out, we wanted to speak to the manager but he would not come and speak to us face-to-face and would get a staff to act as intermediate. We waited for him for at least 20 mins- when he (Peter Gallo) finally decided to come out of hiding. We explain our discomfort, he didn't really care much about and didn't even try to ammend that. We ask if he would provide us with a complementary ride to the airport and plainly refuse! We ended up missing our flight by 5 mins! Terrible way to finish a great Us trip. He tried to get me to come to Bentley again saying that he will give a discount at our next visit. I will pen off with this question: How can you expect someone to come to a Hotel that didn't care about their needs or suggestions to ammend things?

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons but overall worth the price in NYC”
Reviews.Author: ArielleinMiami
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in NYC, this was my first time staying at the Bentley Hotel. Overall it was a decent hotel, nothing to rave about but for the price and size of the room in NYC I was pleased. The location is great for getting cabs and very convenient for the FDR and LGA. My only complaints were the water not working for a few hours one day...like 7pm on a Friday...key shower times? The walls are very thin so I could hear our neighbors conversation, one of the nights our room was FREEZING. I live in Miami but this was see your breath cold even for a New Yorker, they brought us space heaters at 2am and someone came to look at it the next day...it was a little bit better the next night but not WARM. If I was paying more $ for this room I would have made more of a fuss. Overall if you're on a budget, this is a quality hotel, not sure if I'd stay again in the winter.
