Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, roomy and clean”
Reviews.Author: cosmiccigar
Reviews.Content: The Bentley Hotel has spacious rooms - for NYC - is well appointed and clean. The beds are comfortable, and the shower was good! The hotel has a restaurant/bar on the top floor with an incredible view of the Queensboro Bridge. Breakfast is only buffet and is expensive ($17.95) for what is typical breakfast buffet fare but complimentary coffee is available. Worth walking to one of the local diners for a more moderate priced meal. The location, 62nd and York on the eastside is about a 5-10 minute walk to the subway (depending on how fast you walk!) which has its plusses if you are a walker. It was nice to be a little out of the way as I usually stay around Times Sq or in Chelsea and those areas have a much more energetic vibe. This felt like a neighborhood which was kind of cool. We found the walk from the subway to be quite safe even late at night. Certainly a good option when visiting NYC if you are not intimidated with walking!

Reviews.Title: “I like the Bentley... just a few comments"”
Reviews.Author: BROOKLYNLIZZIE
Reviews.Content: overall I really like the Bentley. The staff is great and the neighborhood can't be beat.... its a really sweet upper east side vibe. Just a few things could have been better. 1. My key card to my room would stop working after a day or so. I had to go down to the desk to have it recharged. This happened more than once. They really need to handle that better. 2. the roof top breakfast which is just continental is 17 dollars a person. Thats just crazy. Charge 12 dollars instead and your visitors won't have to go to the diner. 3. Instead of soap they give us body wash in a bottle..... i think soap would be nicer. 4. If theres a way to do it, it would be great to get the rooms more sound proof. I could hear the people next door pretty clearly.... I think this is because the hotel use to be an office building. Overall though, I would recommend this hotel. I felt safe and the rooms were really really nice. The staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Lman86
Reviews.Content: Seemed nice and staff was friendly when we arrived. Room was too hot with apparently no way of turning down the heat at night so we did not sleep well. We had NO hot water when we woke up on Jan 16th. After calling down to the desk, we were informed that the whole building had the problem. We checked out, unshowered and miserable, and the front office manager, Mr. Gallo, informed us that there was nothing he could do because A) we booked through hotels.com so no refund of any kind and B) the problem was not the hotel's but "outside" (the hotel did have water so this was news to us that it was the city's responsibility to provide hot water). If you book through a third party, or want to sleep, or want to shower in the morning, or want a hospitality staff who cares, DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “COLD room - heaters didn't work. Nice hotel though.”
Reviews.Author: VictorW318
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for the price and the location near relatives. Was upgraded to an executive suite which has a nice work area, two tvs and high windows -- which, unfortunately are single pane. On these very cold (below freezing) days the two window style heaters didn't seem to work...one with paltry heat, the other blowing room temperature air. I should have asked for another room but I chose to stick it out. With two blankets, it was still chilly, too cold for a shower in the morning although I could warm up the bathroom with the hair dryer. Location is off the beaten path. Closest bodega is a long block away. NO COFFEE IN THE ROOM???!! Didn't use the rooftop resturant ($20 for continental breakfast) but it supposedly has good views. Parking is a reasonable $25/night (enter around the corner, almost getting on the highway there's a little alley to go around the block). Staff was nice. Room quality good - clean, a little quirky, modern decor, two TVs. Next time I would ask for another, hopefully warm (or cooler in the summer) room. Verify the heaters work!

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious-Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: gregg532
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the decor at best. But look a little harder and the cracks soon appear. Either pay the extra to go closer to Times square as the hotel is a 10 minute walk from the nearest subway, or if you are going to stay this far out of town get a better hotel for half the price close to Queen's Plaza subway, in Queen's. The biggest problem is noise. You must expect some traffic noise when in Manhattan but in this hotel the walls are so thin you could clearly hear every word in next doors conversations, as well as other things! This proceeded to expose the poor service from recption staff. When a group of girls decided to have a party in the corridor I played the game until 2359 but then I consider it courtesy for the hotel to have a word. I complained once and was told a member of staff would call the girls room. Because the walls are so thin we waited to hear the phone ring. It didn't. So at 0030 I called reception again and they promised to send security. They didn't. At 0100, the girls decided it may be getting too late for loud music and giggles. Next TV doesn't work. No Kettle, or complimentary Teas and Coffee in room. Instead you have to travel to the 21st floor restaurant to get a drink in a paper cup, and then get back in the incredibly slow lift to go back to your room. However, this is only if you are told there are complimentary drinks available, which we weren't until the penultimate day! The restaurant is overpriced, and when not booked for a private function is too quite and has no atmosphere except for the occasional guest seeking a free coffee. If you're in an emergency and need to check flight details like us, don't expect the staff to help you out and let you borrow a computer to 30 secs. Instead, you have to go to floor two and use the expensive business suite. Air conditioning is a 1980's stand alone unit which can't be used unless you have ear defenders, but even when set too cool, blows out warm air anyway.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: ilvchgo
Reviews.Content: I use trip advisor always before I travel and I come to NY often. I chose this hotel in part because I was amazed the GM Helena Blat answered every review. This hotel offers everything down to a toothbrush. The room sizes are amazingly clean, they are spacious as is the bathroom, the rooftop restaurant has a breathtaking view of the city and complimnetry coffee and the staff is warm and friendly. I will stay nowhere else in the future. I have found my home away from home. Thank you Helena for making my stay memorable. Cari Reporto

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Friendy & Helpful Staff: Visiting from the Second City”
Reviews.Author: 2ndCityTraveler
Reviews.Content: I don't normally give hotel ratings, but I really think that the Bentley deserves a great one. The entire staff of the hotel (front Desk, cleaning, maintanance crew) were extremely friendly and helpful from the very moment we stepped in. Our visit was from July 8-11, 2010. We arrived at the hotel 2-hours ealier than the check-in time, but the staff offered to keep and secure our bags and directed us to areas on the second floor were we could change our clothes and freshen up from our flight. The rooms and hallways were very clean and well maintained. The view from our west-facing 20th floor room was spectacular (facing toward Central Park and the Midtown skyline). The location of the hotel was perfect for our needs. The hotel is located in a fairly clean and relativly quite area (near Rockefeller University), but within walking distance to Central Park and the number 6 subway which can get you to Rockefeller Center (Midtown), Washington Square (Greenwich Village), and Downtown. The only, and very minor, complaint I can think of was the poor TV reception in the room, but hey who needs TV when you're visiting Manhattan!! I would highly recommend this hotel and we are planning to stay there again the next time we are in town

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: knasr
Reviews.Content: I needed a fairly spacious room for my stay in Manhattan given that (i) I had a fair amount of luggage and (ii) I had to do some studying for an upcoming exam in the city. I didn't want to drop hundreds and hundreds of dollars to get both criteria checked. I was very satisfied with my room at the Bentley. I got all the space and quiet I needed to get my studying done. For under $200, this is a steal in NYC. Other than that, the room was impeccably furnished and clean. The bed is also very comfortable. Finally, the food at the rooftop lounge is actually quite good and offered at affordable prices. Staff were also very attentive and responsive to my requests. A couple of caveats: (i) this hotel is a bit far to the east. The nearest subway stop is a bit of a hike. (ii) 3PM check-in time is a bit overkill but in fairness I was offered my room early. (iii) free wi-fi would be nice (but I understand that with these low prices, it is understandable the need to charge for service) (iv) the electrical outlets could be more accessible in the room (i.e. to plug in laptops etc.) Providing extension cords would be nice Hope this review was helpful, definitely worth staying at!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: blessedinTN
Reviews.Content: Paper thin walls, tiny room. The kids kept stubbing their toes on the sharp squares that raise the beds. Only two drinking glasses in the room daily even when we requested four. It took room service an hour to bring two extra glasses up,even when we went to the lobby to pitch our request again after 30 minutes. Worst part of our trip? Our 7:30am wake up call never happened. Our phone did ring at 12:30am or about two hours after we placed our 7:30am request. If I had not gotten up to use the rest room at 7:45am and realized that our wake up call never happened, we would have missed our flight. I think I woke up then because the window treatments don't completely cover the entire window so the sun shines right the pillow every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: Julz1988
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bentley Hotel for a couple of nights over thanksgiving in November and would highly recommend this hotel to friends/family. Upon arrival the front desk staff were very helpful in checking us into the hotel and even arranged a room upgrade. Room sizes are ok, (Its NYC remember) and the location is slightly off the beaten track. However, taxis are plentiful in the area and the subway is a ten minute walk away. The hotel was very modern and furniture was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: KatherineAtTrak
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting in the City and my husband came along so we coluld enjoy the weekend. I booked the hotel through an "unknown" request with Travelocity.com. So I didn't have much say over which hotel I wanted. I absolutely loved the hotel. My room had the best room - there were 6 large windows. It was very clean, every one was so helpful, and it was decorated very "smart." I would 100% recommend this hotel to business travelers or vacationers. It is a walk to Central Park Area but it is a pretty walk with much to see.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, offbeat location, plumbing issues”
Reviews.Author: bfpop
Reviews.Content: First the good. The hotel is located right on the river, so a trip to and from LaGuardia is quick. Also, one of the island's three gas stations is right on the corner, so catching taxis is a breeze. The room was ok. Apparently we had been upgraded to a junior suite, as they tried to charge us for that when we checked out. Since we didn't know what a regular room was like, we didn't know this. The heating/ac system is beneath the window. One unit continued to heat even when we turned it down to cool (it was unseasonably warm). The other unit would cool, but had a chirp. Disturbing. The staff was friendly, however, and made every effort to be helpful. Except when my wife opened her eyes in the shower and found herself covered with brown gunk. She freaked out! A call to the desk revealed that they had had issues with the water pump that morning and that running the water for awhile would clear it up. Would have been good to know before she was in the shower and covered in brown goo. They offered NO compensation for this trauma. OH, by the way, wifi costs extra. Will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in expensive Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: BillDallas2
Reviews.Content: Manhattan hotel prices are absurd but this is a good value comparatively. This is like a normal hotel in a normal city - clean, safe, courteous staff. Other Manhattan hotels for under $200 a night seem to have some creepiness but I didn't detect it here. The only downsides are paying for Internet (not too expensive for just a boarding pass), and the location is a hefty walk away from the subway or Central Park. My Queen room size was a little bit compact by other cities' standards, but for what I want a hotel for I'll take the tradeoff for price savings in expensive Manhattan. I called the desk to report nonworking hair dryer and maintenance arrived in 2 minutes (and politely noted the power cord was out - dohhh!). I stress the positive professional service level I received - front desk, doorman, maintenance, cleaners. Has electronic doorkeys - which I consider mandatory. There's an up-scalish grocery store a couple of blocks south. I was surprised to find no riff raff being so near the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Personal Service.”
Reviews.Content: The room was great and very clean with great views of the 59th Street bridge. Being far on the Upper East Side was perfect for us but could be a trek for others. We had a junior suite. However, the road noise from the bridge was surprisingly loud and the windows did a poor job of filtering out the clanking noise. There is complimentary morning coffee and the NY Times is available as well. The front desk and staff were great and the bed was clean. The bathroom was clean and spacious for a NYC hotel. We are return customers and the manager left a welcome treat for us. This was very much appreciated. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay, awful room not matching description nor category, unpleasant reception staff.”
Reviews.Author: jdw25
Reviews.Content: We booked the Bentley hotel for 5 nights at a discounted rate via Expedia. We specifically choosed a king bed in upper category boasting "wall to wall window with view over ther river or the city". What a disappointment ! When we arrived, maybe because of the discounted rate, we were given the choice between a BLIND room on the ground floor (window was painted so to hide the view on the ground floor AC engine) and a twin standard room with street view, very old furnitures, no safe etc.... The reception staff was extremely unpleasant, offering no apology, no compensation, faking not to understand what the problem was. We took the twin room on the promise that we would be moved on the day after. The room we were given was finally a king room with bridge view. Generally speaking the hotel needs serious refurbishment. We were lucky to come by may, I can't imagine how things go during summer since AC engines is IN the bedroom and makes it sound like an airport runway when it's turned on. We did not even try the breakfast room described as having amazing views since the first time we wanted to do in the morning was getting out.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel, and the rooftop rest. has an amazing view and great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Janelle40
Reviews.Content: i recently have stayed at the bentley hotel. i was very amazed of the luxury of the hotel and their price - prices are unbeatable. My favorite part of this hotel has been the restaruant located at the hotels rooftop. its exxtravagent and has an amazing view of all manhatten. i was humbly welcomed and the service i was accomadated with has to be one of the best services i have encountered in New York City. The staff at the restaruant were very welcoming and i was very pleased with their service. Cannot wait to return. Thanks for making my stay so pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of work...”
Reviews.Author: SDSimmy
Reviews.Content: I booked this property on Hotwire and am always a little skeptical of what you get. I would have normally booked a four star but took a chance on a three star rating as I was traveling by myself and figured I could weather a less than stellar stay as I was only here for one day and two nights. All in all I thought the property was okay when I first checked in but then the wheels fell off. Here are the items that I endured... Check-in: I booked through Hotwire but when I checked my bank account I saw that my credit card was charged for the room. When I asked the front desk they told me that when I gave my card the person checking me in made a mistake and charged my card for the full stay and didn't notice the Hotwire precharge. I asked for them to remove the authorization and they told me to trust them that it wouldn't be billed - not very convincing. I guess we will see if I get billed twice and what happens to the traveler on a budget who gets an extra $400 authorization - they didn't pay attention to detail obviously. Guest Room: The room was clean from what I could tell, however there were several items that I found completely unacceptable. First the front door bolt lock didn't work - I tried pulling and and tugging to get it to bolt with no luck. Second was the television - they have older 32" LCD televisions but the remote battery was obviously weak as I struggled throughout my stay with changing the channel effectively, volume control and on/off. The television picture was horrible - no HD and most of the analog channels were mislabeled and very fuzzy - not good. I then took a look in the mini-bar and although it had power it was warm - the drinks were not even a bit chilled - the mini-bar was effectively not cooling at all. I then thought about trying one of the snicker bars but when I opened the package and took my first bite I about choked as the snicker bar was so old that it was that awful stale taste - can't imagine if they date inventory at all or even check the mini-bar at all? Internet Access: One of my biggest pet peaves is a hotel that charges for High Speed and then gives you awful internet speeds. I did some speed checks throughout the stay and the best speed I received was 168kbps - this is 1/100th of the speed I get at home. I couldn't even download a large powerpoint. Can't believe I get charged $10 a day for Internet that averaged a 2x speed of normal dialup at 56.6kbps. THIS IS TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE - I would have been upset if it was complimentary!!! Also, I couldn't bill to the room and had to bill my credit card separately and they must have some guy and a truck providing service because I got a personal e-mail from some guy named Lee Matthew at Lee@Cronow.com! I really don't trust having to give my credit card to an unknown entity that is obviously a garage based operation. Roof top restaurant: I went to get a drink and an appetizer. The bar has a nice view of the bridge but the atmosphere in the bar/restaurant was pretty weak. There was a television hanging at an angle and appeared to be close to falling off the wall. They had a lot of staff but it was obvious that they hadn't been trained well. When I received my food they didn't even offer me condiments or napkin and silverware. I shouldn't have to ask for thisand chose the NY Steak sandwich - which was okay. Attention to detail is key and this property could do so much better. Little things like quality internet service, television service and amenities, competant check-in and dining experience - if I would of had one of these items I might not have written this review. A comfortable bed and hot shower are not the only things I look for when choosing a hotel! Chuck

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel at a good price."”
Reviews.Author: wzwks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Bentley for 3 nights. We booked online through Bookit for $186--nothing else at this luxury level was close to that price. Our room was lovely--very clean and comfortable with every amenity. The front desk staff was friendly and extremely helpful. We would stay here again without hesitation. Two points of caution, however: 1) We had a late-night appetizer and a drink at the restaurant on the top floor and, while, the view was amazing, the service was almost non-existent. We couldn't find a server to get a second round OR to pay our tab, and it was empty. 2) The location is extreme east, so if you are traveling all over Manhatten and walking isn't an option, you will be taking cabs. This wasn't an issue for us--we really had a great stay at Hotel Bentley.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: IndustryKirs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bentley Hotel for one night with 3 of my friends and I have to say that the experience was pretty good! The room was clean, the bathroom was clean (Could use better ventilation though), and the customer service was excellent! As soon as we pulled up to the hotel we were met by the doorman who immediately helped us with our bags. The front desk staff was great and provided us with directions to shops and other attractions in the area. The room does tend to be a little on the warm side though, but it was not unbearable. We stayed on the 17th floor and had a wonderful view of the city! The hotel is about a 10 min cab ride from all the action of downtown, but is nestled in a nice residential area that we felt pretty safe to walk around in at night. Lexington Ave and Park Ave are just a few blocks away and there are plenty of eating places around the area. We had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, bright clean rooms, loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: westford
Reviews.Content: 8 of us spent two nights at the Bentley Hotel. I were delighted when I opened the door to my room to find a beautiful view of the East River and the Queensboro Bridge. The room was large enough, very bright, modern, clean and just perfect. Bathroom also large enough and just right. The location was York and 62nd which was a nice walk over to Lexington, Madison and 5th Avenue. I had to purchase the rooms in advance and paid more than my daughter, who recommended the hotel, because she finds good bargains last minute. In spite of paying more, I felt it was a good value. Staff was helpful, especially "taxi man" who always found us a taxi in no time. When there was a mistake on the bill, it was immediately taken care of, no problem. Only negative, the refrigerator was hot. The note on the fridge said something like "don't open or we'll charge you". Wasn't sure what that was about. Just to check I opened it on purpose 20 times and wasn't charged ??? I would have liked to have had use of it for cold water and to store the chicken liver pate purchased at Katz Deli. Can't wait for a revisit to the Bentley Hotel, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: njarapteleh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated, in the lobby, as well as in the rooms. It IS true that they are hot though, and the air does not really work that well. If it was 10 degrees warmer in NYC, I would have been in BIG trouble. I enjoyed my stay though. It is also true that the beds are tiny....I'm 5'0" and my feet were hanging off the the bed! I was so tired though, that I folded my legs back and went onto sleep. One thing I will say is that the evening concierge ( Puerto Rican female) is rude, and uncaring. She half-assedly gave me directions when I asked for them, and was basically like, "Here's a map. Good LUCK." Needless to say, I ended up lost. I had to ask several times for extra towels and hair shampoo, which I did not like. I had a BEAUTIFUL view of the Queensboro Bridge outside my window, which I enjoyed. It's NOISY though. There were revelers that woke me up @ 4A.M.! Talk about the City that Never Sleeps..... I takes about 20 minutes to get to the subway, and it's an uphill walk. The price was $80.00 cheaper than what was quoted on booking.com though, and you can't beat that with a bat!

Reviews.Title: “Moderate”
Reviews.Author: Ashley_vM
Reviews.Content: The Bentley belongs to World Hotels. Usually I trust this chain cause I had really great experience in Maya hotel in Kuala Lumpur. But this one is just not that good. I took it because my friend lived on East 63nd street, a few minutes away by foot. I booked a queen-size bed, but I got twin beds and they insisted I got two queen sized beds. Well maybe Americans have different definition for queen size. It's loud if you open the window cause much traffic outside, you feel like you stay in a motel. The door of bathroom (so small bathroom!) was defective, so I could not really close it properly. Everything looks old and desolate. But anyhow I don't expect much from New York hotels. I had once paid 480.-US$ per night for Four Points Chelsea, what a terrible service and experience I got! The receptionist can speak German, funny. In the room rate of 170 Euros per night no breakfast was included. But as I said, that's hotels in New York, don't expect much unless you pay US$1000 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: britaNorway Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights, and will never come back! The bathroom was awful; very dark, the toilet did`t flush down, th shower was a joke - and the last night the washstand fell of the wall...There was no apologies from the staff at all!! The elevators were VERY slow, the AC didn`t work and the rooms were not as clean as we wished. A very bad experience!

Reviews.Title: “Compact and cool, good customer service”
Reviews.Author: blahberher
Reviews.Content: Hotel is modern with modern decor. Rooms are very comfy. Beds have down pillows and a body pillow, middle of the night started sneezing probably because of down and housekeeping delivered a hypo allergenic pillow right away. Rooms are small because it is Manhattan. Location is a bit far out all t he way on the East Side.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise in NYC”
Reviews.Author: rthrbovacation
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our trip to NYC. We stayed on the 14th floor of the Bentley Hotel on October 9th and 10th. It was a bit pricey but I guess that is normal in NYC! I was a little worried due to some of the reviews but was pleasantly suprised. We arrived at around 9am and due to the hotel being booked the night before, we were not able to check in early - we figured this would be the case anyway so it was not a big deal. The hotel let us check in our luggage and away we went for the day. When we returned they brought our luggage to our room. The room was a decent size. I had never stayed in NYC before so I had only read that the rooms in the city were small. I was expecting a crawl space :) It was pretty roomy and very clean. The hotel staff was very friendly and very helpful. We had asked for a recomendation for an Italian restaurant - which they gave us (and it was fantastic!! Right up the street!) and they also gave us a list of many other restaurants in the area! My only disappointment was that I had read that there was a rooftop restaurant - it was definitely on our agenda to eat there...but when we arrived we found out that the restaurant was closed for an event and did not re open until Monday so we were not able to check it out. The hotel is in a very safe area. I never once felt uncomfortable walking - even late at night. Someone in another review said you have to hike blocks to get a taxi....there were taxis right outside the hotel almost every time we went out and when we wanted, we were able to catch one right outside the door. It is about a 10 minute walk to the nearest subway station which I believe was Lexington and 59th street. Long story short - I was very happy with the Bentley! Safe, clean and nice staff. I would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeYogaQueen
Reviews.Content: I can't for the life of me figure out the Terrible and Poor Ratings for this hotel. I just arrived home from a girlfriend trip to NYC, where we stayed at this property. We ended up getting the room through one of those internet sites where you commit and then find out the name of the hotel afterwards. We upgraded to a double room for an additional 20.00 per night, which was still more than fair, and a real bargain for New York. The hotel was very clean and the front desk people and other employees could not have been more pleasant, helpful and polite. The neighborhood is very safe , we never at anytime felt nervous, and yes, we walked everywhere. Come on guys, so what if you have to walk to attractions and locations? It really is not that far, it makes you feel much more of a part of the city and we all need to walk more anyway. We are staying again at the Bentley next time we make it to NYC. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: PAFDEZ
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is located only 15 min from Laguardia airport (even with heave traffic) ! I have stayed in the past at the Hilton - avenue of the Americas and i missed my flight because of heavy traffic (50 min to get to LGA !!!!). The room, the service, the front desk agents, the concierge ... are just great ! I have stayed in hotels all over Europe, Asia and in North America. I can state that the staff at the Bentley (including the General Manager) know what real hospitality means !

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path....”
Reviews.Author: Bmorechick
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Bentley the weekend of September 24th because my organization was hosting a cervical cancer awareness walk at a park on 86th St. We normally stay at a chain hotel each year but they were unwilling to work with us on the price this year so we felt The Bentley was reasonable. I didn't arrive until after 11pm and luckily I took a taxi because if I were driving, I definitely wouldn't have found it. I noticed that the manager responds to the majority of the posts (which I was thrilled to see) so I am hoping she sees this and suggests to maintenance that they luminate the outside sign. I can see how people would go right by it and not even see it. The lobby is really well decorated and made me anxious to explore the rest of the hotel. I had to print out some items for the walk the next day so I used the business center on the 2nd floor. It is really large. When I asked about the location at the front desk, the agent told me he wasn't sure if it was open. I didn't need a key or anything to access it so I would just confirm the hours if you absolutely HAVE to get something done while you are there just to be on the safe side. The rooms are nice but there was a slight odor to our room (703) as soon as you walk in. It wasn't overpowering and you really didn't notice while in the room. The beds were comfortable but there was no sheet on my bed, just the comforter and the fitted sheet. I thought that was a little odd. The AC is a bit out dated and a little loud but nothing to keep you from sleeping. It was, however, not very cold. I tolerated it the first night because I was so tired after a long day but the next day it really was too hot in there. I called the front desk, they sent maintenance up right away and he changed the filter. After that I had no problems. The bathroom is really nice. There is a glass partition that only covers half of the shower. Although aesthetically it's gorgeous, it is not very functional. You can't move it so you can only hope that the person before you did not leave the shower part engaged because if so, your hair will get drenched once you turn the water on. While in the shower, the water gets on the floor because again, there is only the half partition. Some colleagues told me that the rooftop restaurant had great food but it was closed when I arrived on Friday and closed unexpectantly on Saturday. We did go up anyway so we could have a few drinks. It is beautiful. It reminded me of a really swanky NY club/lounge. The view was gorgeous and even better at night. I would highly recommend going up there at least once. The location was fine for me during that visit. There is gas station next door and a pizza place on 64th (I wasn't impressed AT ALL), but other than that, not much in the immediate vicinity as others have already stated. If I was trying to sightsee NY, I would stay closer to the city/action. Although there is a garage the hotel uses for parking, it is on the street behind the hotel. No one told us we had to pay at the hotel, therefore we ended up paying more to the garage attendant. I would give PLENTY of notice when you are ready for your car because they took quite a while. I think the hotel should offer valet parking that way the guests wouldn't have to worry about the parking headaches. The elevators were quite annoying because they were EXTREMELY slow. That was surprising because there are 3 of them and it's not like the hotel is busy. In summary: Pros: great staff, clean hotel, beautiful restaurant Cons: slow elevator, location, parking,

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: NYAddictBelfast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Bentley through an online promotion for $150 per night with an upgrade to a deluxe room included where there was availability. We kept an eye out for better deals in higher starred hotels nearer the time but none came up so we stuck with our original booking - we could not have been happier. We travelled to the nearest subway and walked to the hotel - it is a 10 minute walk. On checking in we were informed that we had been upgraded to a corner suite - it was fantastic! We had a 'large' suite with separate living room and bedroom (huge bed) and two flat screens TVs. The views were amazing too. We both thought the decor was really modern and smart and the room was cleaned immaculately each day. We also loved the complimentary coffee in the restaurant in the mornings (in the lobby during the day too). Generally we find the coffee quite weak in the US but this was more like the European coffee. The views from the restaurant were stunning though we didn't eat here. We didn't have much dealings with staff directly but anyone we came across was pleasant and nice to us. Overall The positives; the views, the price, the rooms, the coffee The negatives; the distance from subway, no room in minibar for chilling drinks We would definitely stay here again if we got a good deal and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “overprice and small”
Reviews.Author: guymichaud
Reviews.Content: Lobby makes you think it will be nice. Room very small, bathroom ha mold all over the tub. Cheap ikea style closet. Rooftop restaurant would need a major overhaul. Business center and fitness club closed because was used as a meeting room...

Reviews.Title: “A Good Option When Midtown is Booked”
Reviews.Author: Phillytravler1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bentley during NY Fashion Week and I was happy to find a hotel in the city that I could afford. As many guests commented, this hotel is not close to many of the main sites that most would want to hit while in the city for pleasure. I knew this going in and it worked for me. I thought that the underground parking at the hotel was quite convenient and reasonable. I will comment on the room service. The food was very good, but the room service bill was VERY misleading. I travel a lot for work and order room service often. The room service slip was handwritten like a dinner check. I did not see gratuity written on the check and I did not have a room service menu in my room. I ordered off the room service menu posted in the elevator. Long story short, I asked the delivery person if there's a place I can write gratuity on the slip and instead of telling me it's already included, he said you can write it anywhere on the check, which I did. Needless to say, he was way overtipped. Keep an eye on your room service checks so you're not surprised when you go to check out. In my opinion, this is a nice, clean, 3.5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: Reefcrazy
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in July 2010. This hotel is located in the east end on 62nd Ave, in a very quiet neighborhood, just 15' walking distance from Central Park and around the corner from the East River promenade, ideal for a relaxing stroll. We got a suite with a bedroom (with king bed) and living room, welcoming bottle of wine, 2 big LCD TV's and an amazing view of the city and East River. Very reasonable prices considering NYC standard. ($179/night). An extra feature: great pasta in the rooftop restaurant with the breathtaking view of the Queensboro bridge. Also, free coffee in the lobby. Staff was very friendly. Cons? A little noisy AC, no usable fridge (other than the small one stuffed with very expensive stuff), no free wi-fi and no coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: steve_harp
Reviews.Content: This was our familyâ€™s first trip to New York and we were very apprehensive about picking a hotel. The Bentley (in Manhattan) was not as close to the theaters and Times Square as we would have liked but it more than met all other expectations. We paid a little over $200/night for a room with taxes, two double beds. On-site parking is $20/day. The hotel was clean, quiet and the people were very friendly. The rooftop restaurant a bit pricey but so are most of the places we ate. It is about 4 blocks to a subway station, and the walk, even at midnight, did not make us feel uneasy. It is just 4 stops from the Times Square stations via subway. $8.25/PP gets you an unlimited subway pass to go anywhere in the city for the day. I would definitely stay there again unless we hit the lottery and can afford the higher priced places closer to prime attractions. Donâ€™t be afraid!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is quite good but ..........................”
Reviews.Author: balearics2010
Reviews.Content: ........................... if you are not a walker then choose something nearer the lights. Just stayed for 4 nights and after a disappointing first few hours it got much better. We were in a room (standard) which i would say was part of a larger room previously, the partitioning wall against the next room was wasted as we could hear everything and they were not really that noisy. Hotel should make walls thicker in standard rooms with more soundproofing materials. (and block off the fake door). Maybe its just a few that was like this ? I would not stay again if in a standard room but would in a corner room if price was lower. Anyway, they were very understanding and put us into a corner room which was soooooooo much better. The location is very good imo, its less busy on the roads outside (but still a little manic) , it is only a 20 min walk away from central park and about 20 mins to the larger shops starting with Bloomingdales. Times square is about 40 mins stroll and Ground zero is about 4 hrs stroll away which includes many many coffee and cake stops. We came across many places such as Grand Central, Tiffanys, times square, Macys, Empire state bulding, Flatiron building, Rockerfella centre , Ground Zero which had a very large discount store across the road and many other sites as well. We caught a yellow cab back to the Bentley and surprised at the cheap cost of 16.50 dollars. The room was very modern and clean but the showers need redesigning , too much water on floor and shower head not that good. The lobby was very smart and so was the restaurant on 21. There is a wine bar being currently constructed by the patio area outside the hotel lobby. Smoking was not a problem as you can use the patio area. Majority of staff were very helpful, especially Danny. He was a world of knowledge on Manhattan. Other doormen/porters were good too but the reception staff were ok but not on the same wavelength as the porter/doormen etc. The 2 ladies staff in the restaurant were very polite and helpful. The front of the hotel needs a facelift , it looked very nice driving up to it but when you look closer it needs some help. I would recommend this hotel but only if in a corner room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Gem!”
Reviews.Author: KarenL25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past Friday night. We had two rooms, both upgraded at check in. From check in to to sadly leaving, everything was perfect. Room was spacious and clean with many comforts and the staff including the restaurant (rooftop) were very friendly. Love the music up there! I am a Travel Agent and delighted to recommend this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, outer edge of town, better off in Brooklyn.”
Reviews.Author: tim_in_boston
Reviews.Content: Service from check in to check out was openly rude and frustrating. Had to catch taxis to get close to anything, might as well stay in Brooklyn and stay in a cheaper, better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and room, off beaten path”
Reviews.Author: travelmom1369
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. The room was updated and clean and room. They upgraded to king bed and still had room to get around. We were gone from the room the majority of the day so just used it for sleeping. However, bathroom was very small and no place to put toiletries - one person only. There is room frig, but only has very high priced items in it. No ice machines or vending machines on any floor, we had to ask room service to bring up a bucket of ice. In addition, you had to pay for coffee in the lobby from 6 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. or so, after that it was free. Kinda stunk for no complemetary coffee. The hotel itself is about 1 mile away from the nearest subway - but you're in NY so what do you do besides walk and ride subway!!! Next time we would stay closer to downtown. The hotel does not offer any pick-up from the airport. They charge $50 to get from hotel to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TatevikD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Bentley in June 2009. The hotel turned out to be quite a good one, we really liked the room with large windows overlooking NYC. The bathroom was average, however. The location was also good in upper East Side, however if you plan to do a lot of sightseeing and prefer a hotel from which a Metro station will be 5 minutes away, than Bentley might seem a bit away from the nearest metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems”
Reviews.Author: ohioriver
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel at which you can get a good rate, but for me it isn't worth the problems. The elevators didn't work well for the two days we were there. I was on the 15th floor and one evening had to wait 10-15 minutes to get an elevator to stop at our floor to pick us up. At check in they couldn't locate the key machine and we had to wait a while for someone to bring it back to the front desk. The location is several blocks from any subway stops, a good 10 minute walk at least. The hotel seemed clean but the furnsihings are very dated. If you get an incredible rate and don't mind walking to get to the subway it might be ok if they get the elevator problem addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bentley”
Reviews.Author: keksia
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Bentley in general. We had two rooms. They were both modern, quiet, clean and large. The hotel is about a 10 min walk to the nearest subway station. We ended up taking the cab a few times when coming back from sightseeing because we were so tired. The people at the front desk were okay, they can be more friendly and helpful though. The bellboys/doormen were very efficient and helpful though.

Reviews.Title: “great value - clean - what a view - very helpful mgr. & staff”
Reviews.Author: pyewacke
Reviews.Content: family stayed total of 3 nights. needed to be near HSS (hospital). room was "very clean", staff was very helpful (when needed). i was lucky enough to be on the south side facing the 59th st. bridge. what a wonderful, relaxing evening view after a very stressful day, just watching the river & bridge traffic was better than whatever was on the large flat screen t.v. A.C. needed to get a "boost" from maintenance, but that was done immediately. could have used an ice/soda machine and a courtest refrigerator (rather that honor bar). but all in all a very, very pleasant stay. parking facility around the block at resonable price.. manager very accomodating. would absolutely stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, not central, but use the buses!”
Reviews.Author: wgpettigrew
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel: clean and comfortable. Air con a bit noisy, but we are used to noisy air con in the U.S.A. Staff very pleasant and helpful. We stayed for five nights and had a great holiday. First thing to do is buy the unlimited travel ticket. It costs around 47 dollars but is well worth it, especially if you use the buses. We stopped using the subway because the buses let you see so much more of the city. Once you work out the grid system it is very easy. It is a five minute walk to get a bus. (3 blocks) The subway is further away. The Ritz Diner up the road is great for breakfast. I would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Thomas040
Reviews.Content: Location, staff, room, food everything was just amazing. I holiday i will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quite Place to Stay and a Great Value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: SuperDave41042
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights over the fourth of July holiday. I felt like this place was a steal as I got it as a 'top secret hotel' from travelocity for $105 a night. I travel to NYC frequently for business and usually spend closer to the $350-400 a night range for similar quality hotels. The room was modern decor, clean, and quiet (which isn't always the case at hotels in NYC). We were upgraded (at no cost) to a deluxe room, which was a good size comared to other hotels in the area that I've stayed at. The rooftop bar was good for drinks/view. The only downside for us was it is kind of out of the way. It's about a ten-fifteen minute walk to the 4,5,6 subway line at 59th/Lexington Ave. We took taxis most of the time and never had trouble getting one around the hotel, even during rush hour periods. I'd definitely consider staying here even up to a $200 price point.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: kak1974
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. The room was tiny and was hot as an oven! I had to call out in the middle of the night for a portable fan. My room didn't circulate the air at all. I felt like I couldn't breath. I know it gets hot in New York, however; this hotel needs to spend the money and update their air conditioners. If it's this hot in the summer, then I bet the rooms are freezing in the winter. Very uncomfortable stay. I will never stay here again and I will make sure I tell everyone I know about my experience here.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: graciesmom_0623
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel.I stayed there with my two daughters(ages 20 and 24) this past week and I can't say anything negeative about the hotel.The front staff was kind, courteous and helpful.The room was immaculate.The elevator problem must have been fixed because we had no problems with the elevators.The air conditioning was working fine.I asked for more fresh towels and they were delivered to the room within 15 mins.When we first got there, we were having a little trouble with the cable tv and a technician was to the room within 10 min and fixed the problem.We didn't eat at the rooftop restaurant so I have no opinion on that but they have a nice little outdoor covered patio at the entrance that was nice to sit out at in the evening.Yes, it is in an out of the way area, but that it what we wanted.Lots of good reataurants and shops within walking distance and a nice walk to Central Park.Don't listen to the negative reviews.The Bentley is a very nice place to stay and a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Lilyfan
Reviews.Content: The room itself was fine other than it had no coffee maker. Bed was comfortable and clean. No ice machine was accessable to the guests.. You had to have it delivered after request at the front desk. Only one drink machine in the entire 21 floor hotel. Buffet breakfast was very expensive. The location was a bit out of the way unless you are a walker. It turned out ok as there was no rain while we were there except for some brief showers on our first evening there.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: I am a Fairmont and "W" fan. I am now a fan of the Bentley Hotel. Crazy great boutique set up. If you want good value and a super hotel this is it! I am not sure about the other bad reviews, but my experience as a seasoned traveller was EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: DSMTraveller1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bentley for the Memorial Day weekend. We live in Midwest and decided to go to New York last minute after booking promotional fare with Delta. For convenience purposes we wanted to stay in Manhattan and when looking for accommodations, we found this hotel on Internet which offered very reasonable rate. After checking reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked the stay. The hotel is located ten minutes walk from the Central Park and about 15 minutes from the subway station. We had an early arrival, and the front desk already had the room ready for us, which was a pleasant surprise. Both the hotel and room itself were spotless and very tastefully decorated. The views from the room are magnificent: wall-to-wall windows to downtown Manhattan, Queensboro bridge and the East river. Hotel serves daily expanded continental breakfast ($15) on the top floor which is definitely worth checking out. Variety of fresh fruit, cereal, juices, bakery - all very fresh. Complimentary coffee and tea are served in the lobby from 11am to 11pm. Upon check out, hotel offered to leave luggage downstairs, which was very convenient as we wanted to spend the afternoon in the city. Reported problems with the hotel's elevators have been fixed, so it never took us more than couple of minutes to get from the room to the lobby. Hotel staff was very responsive. Cabs around the hotel are plentiful and very inexpensive (about $10) to most places) in Manhattan. Overall, very solid four star hotel! We will definitely consider staying at this hotel again when visiting NYC next year.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs - beware”
Reviews.Author: Kushmir
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my father, in separate rooms. My father got badly bitten by bedbugs, apparently a common problem in NY hotels. The air conditioning is old fashioned and very noisy. Whilst we were there the weather turned cooler and the system could not provide adequate heating, the solution was to provide one small, domestic electric heater, not enough to heat both the bedroom and sitting room areas. Breakfast is provided on the top floor, with excellent views but a dreadful, overpriced breakfast. There are better, cheaper diners nearby. Bedbugs and heating aside the rooms are of a good size, and have large windows.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely room”
Reviews.Author: singlishMelrose_MA
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about the hotel when I read some of the reviews, but my one night stay at the Bentley Hotel was quite pleasant. The walk from Central Park was much longer than I anticipated - at one point I thought I would end up in the river before I found number 500 - but the staff was courteous and helpful. I stayed on the sixth floor in a standard double room. The decor was pleasant; the room immaculate. Although I was tempted, I did not surrender to the enticements of the minibar, but I must say, it was one of the best stocked ones I have seen. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is residential and pleasant. Many restaurants nearby offer good value. Unless I needed to stay closer to the action, I would definitely stay at the Bentley again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, friendly staff, GREAT views!”
Reviews.Author: rkandsk
Reviews.Content: I don't know how anyone can give this hotel a bad review! It is beautifully decorated with a contemperary feel. The rooms are large for NYC standards with all the amentities you could need. The bathroom is huge (once again, for NYC standards). It is true, the elevators are incredibly slow, which we learned to deal with by stepping out and pressing the botton while the rest of our group got the last of their belongings for the day. Not really a big deal. The location is good and bad. The bentley is located right on the East river next to the Queensboro bridge. The view is amazing from the hotel room and from the rooftop bar/restaraunt. The bridge lights at night are gorgeous. The only bad point to this hotel is that it is about a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest subway (up hill!). We did that once and then decided to take a cab back and forth since we were doing enough walking during the day. Cab to the subway is about $5, cab to times square is about $8-10. The staff was incredibly nice/helpful. They recommended good restaraunts and would bring us extra towels, ice at any time of the night. We also really enjoyed the leave your luggage feature. Our flight didnt leave until the evening so we wanted to make the most of our visit. We checked out that morning and left all of our luggage in their luggage storage room. (the staff tags it like an airport and gets it out for you when you return). We were able to enjoy another full day of NYC without our luggage in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, I'd never stay there again due to the elevators”
Reviews.Author: richm0
Reviews.Content: Everything besides the unbelievably slow elevators is ok with the Bentley. I literally waited more than 7 minuets on 5 separate occasions during my 3 night stay. I will never stay there again. It became a joke with other guests in each slow elevator ride or during the wait for the elevators in the lobby. Business or Pleasure, you have to be able to find a hotel that has working elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Bentley hotel, not bad at all.”
Reviews.Author: raffaeu
Reviews.Content: I have been in New York for a week-end of shopping starting from Thursday to Saturday. The hotel check-in was supposed to be at 3 p.m. but because I arrived at 12 they allowed me to leave the luggage there and take a trip of the neighbor, that is pretty nice for food if you move to the parallel 1st avenue. The room was the 1404, pretty nice, is a junior suite with a king bed, for the price of 300 USD a day including taxes. THe room is not bad but the hotel needs some major improvements, for sure! The lift doesn't allow you to go down directly, for some how. You have to catch the first one available and then move up on a floor, then you can go to the lobby. The breakfast, for 14 USD, was horrible and poor. No hot food (eggs, bacon, pancake ... and co) and the coffee, one of the worst in the city. The room was at the 14th floor but the isolation is not really well done, so it's noisy and you hear the traffic all night long. The room by itself was spacious and very well maintained, but I need to admit that the AC was really junky, it didn't blow anything that was 'cold air' in my opinion. So, I have been at the marriot in the financial district, last year, and for 100 USD more a day, there is no comparison with this one. Also remember that the Bentley is far away, the only nice place around there is the 59 crossing with the 1st avenue, a lot a shopping down there. Anyway the stuff is very kind and the cleaning service not too bad, but they clean up the room around 3 pm ...

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and it's staff provided a very comfortable stay during a difficult time.”
Reviews.Author: phylhoff
Reviews.Content: In February my husband had surgery at Sloan and was there for 7 days. I stayed with my children and then by myself at the Bentley during this difficult time. The accomodations were clean and comfortable and I found the staff to be helpful and accomodating. The rooftop bar and restaurant gave us a chance to have a quiet dinner in a lovely atmosphere. Also, the close proximity to the hospital was wonderful and made it easy to go back and forth. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ghastly Smell Throughout the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TourEiffelTrois
Reviews.Content: Firstly, our room was great. We were upgraded to a corner room with a magnificent view of life on the East River and Queens Borough Bridge. Plusses: toiletries nice, fantastic bed, friendly service, attractive decor. So why only 2 stars? The entire hotel stunk like pine tree car "fresheners." It was nauseating and we had to wash out all of our clothes when we got home. Other minuses: Location. You might as well be in Queens. This would be a hardship on an extended stay. At one point we didn't get hot water. It got hot after running it, literally, for 30 minutes. What a waste. They didn't take the problem seriously. There was 1 thing that really pissed me off: $10. for wifi!! Hello? It's free now in Starbucks and McDonald's. We couldn't get it to work anyway, but it was an inconvenience and cheap of them. me Finally, there was a big stove in the room blocking the closet. Huh?? It's a mixed bag.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with good value”
Reviews.Author: alegrenoble
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel a year ago and what to say, it is an amazing hotel with amazing staff and rooms. It was kind of cheap for a New York Hotel as well: I and my boyfriend paid 70 euros each in July, which isn't really expensive for a hotel of this standard in New York City ! Our room was spacious, clean, the furniture was nice. The bathroom was amazing as well, and towels were changed everyday. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only flaw is perhaps the location which is a 15 minute walk from the subway station, but we didn't really mind that as we like walking. We didn't go to New York to sit down and relax anyway! The hotel was a little noisy too because of cars and cabs honking the whole time, but it's New York City! We slept very good with some ear plugs. A part from this I will definitely go back to this hotel if I get to go to NYC once again, which I hope will happen in the near future. It was the best trip ever.

Reviews.Title: “average...... at best!!!”
Reviews.Author: RANDAengland
Reviews.Content: Despite contacting the hotel 3 weeks in advance to ask for a east river view, as it was a special occasion, (daughters 18th) we arrived 15 minutes before check in time (not bad considering a 12 hour journey ), and then a 2 hour wait for a room, and after all the waiting, ended up on the 2nd floor with a view of a Yorke avenue roadside building with a 24 hour gas station 1 floor below us!! Double glazing has'nt yet reached the Bentley so it was 7 nights of noise from the gas station, J-Z pumping out his tunes at 3am on the local nightfarers bass enhanced, cd player does not conjuse to a good nights sleep, despite excellent pillows and mattresses. After asking for a room change and then being told to come back tomorrow we decided we had wasted enough time and so got on with it, the wardrobe was full with 5 items or less, despite having a trolley load! There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room with the excuse being complimentry is available upstairs in the restaurant, not so, after waking up, showered, dressed and taking the lift some 20 floors, (coffee is best between waking up and getting showered!) I found myself in the restaurant where lots of people where enjoying their breakfast, only to be interupted by me, on the scrounge for a couple of cups of filter and then being humililated by the waitress who said that from now on it was 3 dollars a cup and no I could'nt have any unless I gave my room number! They need a kettle and some cups in the rooms just like a HOTEL. Anyway after 7 nights there I would say we have a pretty good idea about the Bentley, take comfortable, used, walking shoes as it's a good 15 minutes to the nearest subway, 30mins to times square (walking) rooms are small unless single traveller, mini bar is outrageously expensive, $28 for a small bottle of wine, $6 for a $1 pack of pringles, any problems with the t.v, safe box, lack of toilet roll, clothes hangers,(draw your own conclusions) where promptly dealt with. Rooms where clean ,bathroom was very good, plenty of towels etc and staff where always polite and proffesional. All in all, we would not stay there again, and would not recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mango450
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We got upgraded to a suite on the 12th floor. Very clean, staff were helpful and friendly, location is on the mid east side and close to the subway on 59th and lex. The furniture and bathroom could be updated, but all in all, good value for money and cleaned and serviced daily. The view from the 21st floor restaurant is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: anilaid09
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband in the bentley hotel for 5 days. Had th best time ever. The staff was very friendly asked for another room with a better view, they moved me the next day. Very quiet and the room looks amazing, the bed is very comfortable. Would stay again for sure. Close to subway.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: ughughCO
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this place during the holiday season. I seem to recall it being a rather new establishment. At any rate, the location seemed to be a bit awkward, but in the end worked out to be really wonderful. The east side has extremely cute spots that are usually overlooked by tourists looking to stay more central in the city. At any rate, after a minor inconvenience with our keys, we finally opened the door to our posh, celestial abode. Everything was spotless, the room was very large, the bedroom was a fantasy. The decor is to die for, and the comfort was amazing. While we only stayed a couple of nights and did not take advantage of the Hotel's food, our room was absolutely incredible, and the staff was lovely. Storing baggage is also free, which is not the case at some of the more "well-known", overpriced establishments in mid-town. I could not be more enthusiastic about my recommendation for this place!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Neworleans289
Reviews.Content: The Bentley is the best value in Manhattan by a long shot. I have stayed here on and off since 2001 and have never had a bad experience. The rooms are modern, the view incredible and the staff friendly and competent. The location is in Sutton Place on the edge of the upper east side. I read a few comments about the hotel being a bit far from the center of the "action" but couldn't disagree more. Walk a few blocks toward Central Park and you are right in the midst of great shopping, museums, etc. If you are in town to visit one of the medical centers the walk is even less. I would also recommend taking the time to have a drink at the bar on the top floor - very scenic! On many trips to NYC I have stayed at the RItz Carlton, Plaza, Pierre, Loews, (and on and on) but I always wind up coming back to the Bentley. I can stay at the Bentley for a week for the same price as a single night at the Plaza and I don't have to tip 14 people before I get to my room.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: TonySwede
Reviews.Content: I think the Bentley has good rooms with nice space. The restaurant has a awesome view and the food is okey, no less no more, just okey. Upper East is a good neighbourhood and its pretty close. Not to expensive with a cab from Times Square and a little walk from the subway. The only bad thing is that a gasstation is around the corner and we had a view of it but it didnt bother us, it was always a cab around. :) Overall, a solid hotel to a reasnable price with a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant employees”
Reviews.Author: Gazthetall
Reviews.Content: I am still really upset about my experience at the Bentley Hotel in New York a couple of weeks ago. I arrived the evening of the SuperBowl, that is a Sunday around 6 pm. I innocently asked the young woman at the front desk if she could give us a nice room, as I had my wife with me and I knew that the hotel was famed for its views. She gave me room number 201, which is the worst room in the hotel with no window. The 'window' was blacked out since immediately outside was the hotel air conditioning unit. I will try to atach photos. At check in the receptionist had told me that she 'could not change the room as I was part of a group' Clearly this was nonsense and the hotel was clearly far from full. I don't know why some, thankfully few, people in one's travels are so nasty. Probably she is unhappy, unless I was meant to slip her a few dollars for such a request, in which case I may be just naive. I have traveled all over the world, and I was sorry to disappoint my wife who seldom accompanies me. I would have complained to the hotel but I can't seem to find a site one can contact. I will try to post the pictures. This type of dirty trick does the hotel great harm.

Reviews.Title: “I Luv NY”
Reviews.Author: VatinM
Reviews.Content: Near the Queen borogh bridge. Nice sight. Amazing place, very clean. the restaurant is a right place to see NY and the Queens. Near to the metro station, Lexington and Bloomingdale shop.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet view of the East River and 59th Street bridge”
Reviews.Author: mommy4eyes
Reviews.Content: The best stay in NYC yet! The doorman was always courteous, bellhop was capable, and the artificial narcissus in the halls looked so realistic, I was tempted to smell it. The rooms are clean, stylish, and with 2 walls of window, a breathtaking view of the East River and 59th Street bridge. I would recommend taking the 456 train to city hall and a walk over the Brooklyn bridge while in New York. There is a diner on the other side that sells postcards, some of them struck me as quite surreal, different from the typical tourist junk. I had only two complaints with the hotel. The glass ceiling in the restaurant leaked - and they called a contractor promptly, assuring me I would not be doused with rainwater during breakfast on my next visit. The next complaint was the charge of $18.00 for two bottles of scotch that I did not drink. They gave me a refund. My overwhelming praise of this place is for the peaceful environment that may cure insomnia. I could go back there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than It Looks”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bentley last night, January 24th, and found it to be perfectly acceptable in all respects. It is a good choice if one has to visit one of the great hospitals like NY Presbyterian or Sloan-Kettering just a few blocks away as there are very few hotels that far on the East Side. It really is out of the way for tourists or those having business in Midtown. It is right next to the Queensboro Bridge in an area of heavy traffic . The hotel has a parking garage and it is really convenient to drive to and get out of with access to both directions of the FDR, a real plus for us. The staff is friendly - wonderful, helpful doorman. The rooms are nicely decorated. It is better to get a room on an upper floor because of street noise, or a room with a view of the bridge and river. Bed was comfortable and, being a Sunday night in January, the hotel was very quiet. Bathroom is good, no problem with hot water and upscale bath amenities. No coffee maker in the room was a minus. No newspaper in the morning. Price was a good deal- $149/night on the hotel's website. All in all, a pleasant night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price (even in New York)”
Reviews.Author: acoest
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives - the rooms looked great, were clean, and comfortable. Now the negatives - I tried to take showers at 3 PM and 5 AM and both times had to wait between 15 minutes and a half hour for the water to get warmer than ice cold which I find inexcusable at 250 bucks a night. Although they offer complimentary coffee on the top floor, a hotel at this price should have in room coffee makers for convenience in the morning. The hotel is in Manhattan but is really far east and difficult to access public transportation (and hence the rest of New York) from this location. It is 15 bucks for 24 hours of wi-fi, I have no idea why its not free like every other hotel in this price range. The front desk staff were friendly, but were unable to give even basic instructions to the subway. Although it is not a pricy hotel by New York standards, I believe you can do a lot better and at least get warm water in the mornings somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: lipe1192
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in NYC, and we decided to stay on Bentley based on the price and the internet reviews. The room is good, is pretty big, has a nice bathroom and nice touches, such as the shower products, the bed products, the tv etc. , but if you stay in the front, to the York avenue, the noise is terrible (at least at the first floors)... and here is where our problem begins... we decided to ask to change room, because of the noise and they moved us to a room in the left side, 7th floor. it was better but the room was upside down... all dirty, and the guy who helped us with the luggage felt bad and asked to the front desk to move us to another room. ok, no big deal, the problem is that I left my pair of boots in this 7th floor room, and i forgot it there... later that day, already in the new room, i missed it, and i start looking everywhere and then I realizided that i had left it in the 710 room. Well, what happened is that nobody could find my boots... i lost them inside the hotel i paid 1000 dollars to stay and they didnt care, they didnt compensate me with anything... I was so mad. but well, what will I do? I will never come back and I wouldnt recommend nobody to leave their personal belogings in the room. They might disappear... (plus - our second room didnt have the iHome and the minibar wasnt working)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - in every aspect!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine8881
Reviews.Content: I was organizing a conference in New York in October and wanted to stay a few additional days to relax bit afterwards, so I decided to book two nights a the Bentley Hotel. I booked a single room via HRS (Hotel Reservation Service). When I arrived at the hotel a few weeks later, I was really surprised when I entered the lobby since it looked like a luxury hotel. It was really spacious and elegant. I could not believe that this was the hotel I booked since my rate was really not that high for New York and I had stayed in a hotel which was rated as luxury hotel in the past few days and that was not nearly as luxurious as the Bentley Hotel. The next surprise came when I checked in and I was notified that I got a complimentary upgrade to a suite. I was quite exited and happy since the past fews were quite exhausting and I was really looking forward to relax a bit. The suite was beautifully decorated with a great and comfortable bed, two flat screen TVs and a nice view (the panorama windows where so beautiful!). In the evening I decided to treat myself to a nice dinner at the hotel restaurant at the rooftop. I really enjoyed my dinner, the great view and, by the way, had the best rosÃ© wine in my life! Although you have to walk a bit (about 15 min) to get to the next subway station I would not consider this as a real problem. I really felt safe walking there alone (also in the dark) and you can always take a taxi which is only a few dollars. I would definitely recommend this hotel (especially to female travellers and other people who like design hotels) and I will stay there again when I am in New York the next time (even without an upgrade :-)). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and my stay in this hotel was the perfect end to an exiting stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect New York get-away!”
Reviews.Author: Meplusd
Reviews.Content: The Bentley is beautiful, stylish, clean, and comfortable. We booked online, got upgraded to a suite, and had a gorgeous room with an inbelievable view!! I can't imagine that there is a better value in NYC...

Reviews.Title: “Great views, pity about its location”
Reviews.Author: DanielJW
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to say just how good this hotel actually is. The beds are really comfortable, the rooms tastefully decorated and the staff helpful. Two minor issues were: - a) Water Heater failing during our stay, so no showers for over two hours b) Walls are paper thin, so the sound of another couple 'getting close' seemed to be amplified and heard clearly in our room However, this hotel's main issue is location. Yes, the views are really great. I love the panoramic windows and view of the Queensboro Bridge. But the hotel is far, far away from any of the interesting sites and not even close to a metro station. So, if you've done a long day of walking/sightseeing, the only real option is taxi, and we all know how difficult that can be in NY (during busy periods). Then again, this is effectively a small complaint about a really decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice... awesome view of Queensboro bridge and East River”
Reviews.Author: jerry7mac
Reviews.Content: Okay this is a tip to everyone travelling to New York should know. Do not use Super Shuttle! It is more expensive than taking a cab and the time lost because you have to drop off other passengers is ridiculous. I paid $32 dollars through Expedia and found out it was only $28.50 at the Super Shuttle counter (already $3.50 in the hole). We waited for 15 minutes for the shuttle to arrive to take us to our hotel. There was a couple already inside the van. They said they were in the van for 30 minutes already. We circled the airport and went back to their original pick up to get 2 more people. That's 15 minutes for us in the van, still at the airport. We picked up 2 more riders. Now we have spent 25 minutes in the van, still at the airport. So with the van full with 6 passengers and 1 driver you would assume we would be on our way, but no. We drive to another pick up and get 2 more riders. So now the van is uncomfortably full and we have spent 45 minutes driving around the airport picking up passengers. Not that big of a deal, because we should be the first group to get dropped off. We landed at LaGuardia and our hotel is in the Upper East Side, no brainer! Not the case. The first drop off was in the financial district. Too make a long miserable story a little bit shorter, we spent 2 hours 15 minutes in that van to finally get to our hotel. Which is a 20-25 minute taxi ride. I had already purchased a return ride from our hotel back to the airport. They quoted a 8:30 AM pick up with arrival at 10:30 AM at the airport. Our flight left at 12:59 PM. I ate the $32 dollars and we took a taxi for $23.50. Don't waste your time on Super Shuttle. Take a taxi or a private town car for $36. Okay we finally arrive at the Bentley, hooray! Bellman opens the door and greets us. He grabs our bags and we proceed to check in. I had requested a room on their top floor with the disclosure that it was our 1st wedding anniversary. I let the lady checking us in know about our awful experience getting to the hotel just in case I was being a little crabby. Check in was quick and friendly. We were given our keys to a room on the 6th floor, bummer! Definitely felt let down by the hotel. We go up to the room and open the door to find 2 double beds. 2 seconds later we are back down in the lobby and I talk to an extremely helpful gentleman and inform him of the situation. It's our 1st wedding anniversary, not our 50th! Viola! We get a room on the 11th floor with a view of the river and Queensboro bridge! Plus a king size bed. Room was nice, view was great. Only complaint was the AC. The unit is really old and it doesn't cool down the room very well. You must go up to the restaurant for a drink at night and enjoy the spectactular views! Central Park is 7 blocks east of the hotel. It takes 25-30 minutes to walk there. The closest subway is approximately 15 minutes away. It is a $15 taxi ride to Times Square. The 24 hour coffee service is not available all the time. On the last day, I went to grab a coffee at 10 AM and it was not set up. This occurred twice during our stay. Overall a good boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in heart of manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: sfonhols
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, good view of 59th street bridge particularly in the top floor bar. 10 minutes walk into central park and not much further into times square. Some great bars and restuarants in the local area. Amazingly large rooms for central new york. two double beds in out room, with space around the edges! we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price - even discounted!”
Reviews.Author: roomreviews
Reviews.Content: I got a $168 rate for two nights right after Thanksgiving and given the reviews thought it was worth it (I could've saved about $50 a day at other similar east side hotels) - I was wrong. First it is at the dead area of BEYOND York Avenue, right on the water and the only thing nearby is a Mobile station. Feels deserted as you pull up. Then I came in from an international flight with a lot of luggage - there was no one there to help me and I had to lug up stairs. The front desk was professional and nice - I was upgraded to a King bed. Once inside the room, I liked the decor and the bathroom (nice bath products) but started to notice some glitches. Heat was on and it was 50 plus degrees outside - no way to open a window so I turned the A/C on which I hate to use, but I needed a nap and the heat would've kept me awake. Then there was no hotel directory of services (I didn't know where the gym was or if they had a restaurant etc.) I was too tired to go out for the long walk to a store so I looked for the minibar prices to see what it would cost to drink their water until I had some sleep....could not find a price list anywhere and even looked inside the minibar -- which was as HOT as the room??!! nonrefrigerated drinks - what's the point? They had basic cable but not even HBO? Several channels were just frozen...for their regular rate of over $200 a night, they should spring for better cable. The WORST was housekeeping. Slamming doors for almost a half hour straight in the morning - there were only 10 rooms on my floor but the housekeeper kept walking in and out of rooms and let the door SLAM with a very loud noise. Finally I asked her to close the doors gently as I was jetlagged - was up all night and was trying to sleep. She was rude and said - well, I am checking the rooms.
